loans.use: Purchasing  more fish to sell

loans.name: Jairo

texts.en: Jairo S. Osanois 41 years old, married, and has five children.  He has been operating a cafeteria for four years.  He was previously running a barber shop.   He has employed two people to help him in his business.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money, which has helped him to improve his business.  He hopes to open a big hotel in the future.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES, which he will use renovate his business premises.

loans.use: To renovate his business premises

loans.name: Monique

texts.en: Monique is 32 years old and married with two children between 3 and 8 years old. Monique owns a business selling beans, and her shop is open from 8am to 6pm. She has four years of experience in this business and works every day except the weekends. She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to increase her business by purchasing more beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat, who is 29 years old, married, and the father of one child, operates Jaostec Agencies, an enterprise which sells and installs car accessories such as alarms.  He also sells auto spare parts in order to supplement his income.  Previously a barber, Jopsephat has learned the importance of team work since he joined Hanan group in Faulu Kenya, something that has enabled him to save his money.  He has also been guaranteed a loan with the group members.  Josephat will use the loan of 20,000 Kes to buy car alarms and expand.

loans.use: To buy car alarms and expand.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married woman living with her husband and 3 school-aged children. She is from Lebanon. She has been working as baker for 20 years. In 2009, she opened her own bakery and started to prepare delicious fresh goods and sell them to members from her community and neighboring villages.  She cooperates with her husband to handle heavy living expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to develop her shop. The loan will help her increase her store’s inventory and purchase aluminum stands where she can place panels. In the future, she is planning to extend her operation by opening a restaurant.

loans.use: increasing her store’s inventory and purchasing aluminum stands

loans.name: Josphat  Musyoki

texts.en:
Josphat Musyoki, aged 35, is married to Priscilla  and together they have three children. They live in Eastleigh. He runs a grocery shop in Eastleigh market which is a busy market. He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client.

He has been in the  business for seven years and it gives him a monthly profit of KES. 15,000. This is his second loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to add to his stock of onions, bananas, tomatoes and vegetables in his grocery shop.

If the loans boosts his business, Josphat’s plan is to improve the living standards of his family and extend his business.

loans.use: To add to his stock of tomatoes, onions, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is currently in business selling charcoal. She is 35 years old, married to a driver, with seven children and four of them go to school. Angelina borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to open a shop with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zendia

texts.en: Zendia is currently in business selling beer. She is 35 years old, married to a driver, with one child who goes to school. Zendia borrowed a loan to stock more beer to sell. She hopes to open a shop with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more beer to sell

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en: Asunta is currently in business selling rice. She is 29 years old, married to a businessman, with five children and three of them go to school. Asunta borrowed a loan to stock more small items like rice to sell. She hopes to educate her children with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more small items like rice to sell

loans.name: Voyijas

texts.en: Voyijas M. is currently in a business of selling tea. She is 32 years old and a widow with 7 children. Six of them go to school.  Voyijas requested a loan to stock more tea to sell. She hopes to build a house for her children with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: Stock more tea to sell.

loans.name: Madelena

texts.en: Madelena is currently in a business of selling greens. She is 38 years old and married, with 6 children.  Four of them go to school. Madelena requested a loan to stock more items, like greens, to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more items, like greens, to sell.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia is currently in a business of selling clothes. She is 38 years old and a widow with 8 children.  All of them go to school. Cicilia asked for a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is currently in a business of selling food items. She is 24 years old and divorced, with 3 children.  Two of them go to school. 
Rose asked for a loan to stock more food items, such as cassava.  She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more food items, such as cassava, to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is currently in a business of selling food items.  She is 20 years old and is married to a student.  They have one child who does not go to school. Stella requested a loan to stock more food items, like beans and maize flour. She hopes to pay her child's school fees with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more food items, like beans and maize flour, to sell.

loans.name: Younis

texts.en: Younis is currently in business selling charcoal. She is 45 years old, married to a driver, with four children and all of them go to school. Younis borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently in business selling food items. She is 31 years old, married to an electrician, with two children and both of them go to school. Rose borrowed a loan to stock more food items, for example, sweet potatoes to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more food items, for example, sweet potatoes

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.en:
Eliezer is 30 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 7 years old. He sells maize flour, cassava flour, kilograms of beans, and so on. 

Besides running a shop, Eliezer grows beans, wheat, and sweet potatoes, which are commonly grown in this area.  He employs two people to help him to run these business activities.  

Eliezer has requested  a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to buy more stock for his business because his clientele is growing,  With any additional profit, he will pay school fees for his children and save money for his future.

loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, currently in the business of selling fish, is 34 years old, married, and has six children, all attending school. Elizabeth's loan will enable her to stock more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a house with the extra profits arising from her business.

loans.use: The loan will enable Elizabeth to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is currently in a business of selling bread. She is 40 years old, a widow (her husband was a doctor), and the mother of eight children, all of whom attend school. Margret borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en:
Peruth is 43 years old, married, and has three children aged 19 to 24. Her husband is a driver. She sells fruits & vegetables, as the picture shows. This is her 13th successful year in this business. She currently employs one person, and she operates her business from 6am to 9pm every day except Saturday. 

Peruth has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more fruits & vegetables to sell. She hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 46 years old and is married with six children aged between 3 and 16. She sells a variety of goods such as cooking oil, cosmetics, rice, sugar and African clothes.
Her business is well organized and she employs three people. Judith has had this business for five years. 
Her shop is open from 7am until 4pm every day.  

Judith has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase sugar, cosmetics and rice in a larger quantity in order to get a better price with the profits, she expects to save money for her future, and eventually to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as sugar, cosmetics, and rice.

loans.name: Cilla

texts.en: Cilla is 26 years old, married, and has 3 children,1 of whom goes to school. Her husband is a security guard.  She is currently in the business of selling bicycles, and has requested a loan to stock more bicycles to sell. She hopes to open a big shop with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bicycles to sell

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 28 years old. He is married and has one child who is 3 years old. Jean Bosco is requesting his first loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company. He needs the loan to buy more clothing to sell at his market stall. He has been in business for three years and has two employees in his shop. He works daily from 8am until 4pm every day. 

Jean Bosco has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more inventory for his business. With his additional profits, Jean Bosco will build a new house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for his business

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre M. is 34 years old. He is married and has six children. He has five years of experience selling beans. His business is open from 7am until 5pm every day. 

M. needs his first loan from Vision Finance Company of 300,000 RWF. With this loan, he hopes to expand his business by purchasing more beans in order to increase his sales. With the additional profits, he will be able to pay school fees for his children and save money for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more beans

loans.name: Ferida

texts.en: Ferida G. is currently in the business of selling clothes. She is 26 years old, married to a driver, and has three children, all of whom go to school. G. requested a loan in order to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of clothes to sell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 32 years old.  She is married and has two children aged between 2 weeks and 3.5 years. Vestine earns a living by selling different styles of shoes for women.  This is her 15th successful year in this business. She operates her business from 7:30 am until 8:00 pm every day except on Sunday. 

Vestine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more shoes to sell. Vestine will hopefully earn more profit, which will allow her to reinvest in her shoe business.

loans.use: To buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras - Hernandarias Group

texts.es:
El comité se ha formado con la gestión de la señora Estela Maris B., quien vive en la zona Puerta de sol Hernandarias, en Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para conformar el grupo en la zona.
El comité se denomina Mujeres Luchadoras - Hernandarias. Está en el Primer Ciclo y está constituido por 10 integrantes; es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser responsable y solidario.
Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, trabajarán en conjunto en  la realización de actividades para recaudar fondos que puedan salvaguardar al comité en caso de necesidad, y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento con la institución. Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas a las señoras para el progreso de sus vidas.
Como por ejemplo, la señora Paola S. trabaja de mucama (empleada doméstica) y desea poder brindar a su familia un mejor vivir, pero para ello necesita de este crédito, así logra cubrir las necesidades más urgentes dentro de su grupo familiar y luego con ayuda de todos, iniciar un negocio de comestibles propio.
texts.en:
The committee was formed at the suggestion of Estela who lives in the Puerta de Sol Hernandarias zone of Ciudad del Este.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to put together a group in the zone.

The committee was named Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) - Hernandarias.  This is the 1st loan cycle and there are 10 members.  It is a group that stands out in the barrio for its solidarity and responsibility.  The members possess a great enterprising spirit, working together to realize activities to collect funds that the committee can safeguard in case of necessity, and attempting to close out this stage with very good cooperation with this institution.  Upon acquiring the loan, many doors will be opened for progress in the women's lives.

For example, Paola works as a domestic employee and wants to be able to offer her family a better life, but for this she needs a loan to cover the most urgent necessities of her family group and, then, with the help of all, to initiate a proper grocery business.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE OF PRIMARY NECESSITY, INCLUDING FRUIT, VEGETABLES, AND GROCERIES IN GENERAL

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two young children who are attending school. He had been selling air conditioners and repairing damaged ones for more than 14 years. Then he decided to open his own shop in 2000.  He also performs maintenance on some home appliances such as washers, dryers etc. He represents the main income provider in the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed products and tools for his shop. He hopes that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: To purchase products and tools for his shop

loans.name: Ferida

texts.en: Ferida is currently in the business of selling maize grain. She is 33 years old, married to a builder, and has 4 children -- all of whom go to school. Ferida borrowed a loan to stock more maize grains to sell.  In the future, she hopes to build a concrete house with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more maize grains to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is currently in the business of selling electronics.  She is 30 years old, married to a driver,  and has 3 children -- all of whom go to school. Betty borrowed a loan to stock more electronics products to sell.  She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock electronics products to sell

loans.name: Reader

texts.en: Reader is currently in the business of selling beans and sugar. She is 25 years old, married to a doctor, and has 1 child who is going to school. Reader borrowed a loan to stock more beans and sugar to sell.  She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock beans and sugar to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is currently in the business of selling books. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children -- all of whom go to school. Christine borrowed a loan to stock more books to sell.  She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock books to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in the business of selling fish. She is 48 years old, married to a driver, and has 7 children -- all of whom go to school. Mary borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell.  In the future, with the extra profits she hopes to expand her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To stock fish to sell

loans.name: Adonay

texts.es:
Adonay Pérez C., tiene la edad de 22 años, está soltero y vive con sus papás. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su cafetal y tenerlo en buenas condiciones para esta próxima cosecha. El cuenta con el terreno ya en producción y lo que quiere es incrementar la producción de la plantación para obtener mejores rendimientos en cantidad y calidad este año, al igual que llegar a crecer como caficultor de la zona. El piensa en su futuro y en obtener ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida y así también ir alcanzando sus metas personales propuestas.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Adonay Pérez C. is 22-years-old. He's single and lives with his parents. He wants to buy the necessary supplies for the care of his coffee plantation so that he can have it in good condition for the next harvest. He's relying on land that's already in production, and what he wants is to increase the production of the plantation in order to gain better output in quantity and quality this year, at the same time managing to expand as a coffee grower in the region. He thinks about his future and about earning an income to improve his quality of life and achieve his personal goals. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the care of his coffee plantation

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia F. M., está casada y vive con sus 6 hijos y su esposo. Ella quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su cafetal y tenerlo en buenas condiciones de producción este año. Ella cuenta con el terreno ya en producción, que está en buenas condiciones. Lo que ella quiere es incrementar la producción de su plantación para  tener más rendimiento a la hora de cosecharlo. Ella piensa en su futuro y en la de sus hijos, quiere brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y que lleguen a ser profesionales en alguna área establecida.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Nidia F. M. is married and lives with her husband and six children.  She wants to buy supplies to help with her coffee plantation to ensure optimum production conditions this year.  Her land is already in production and in good condition.  She wants to increase the plantation's output for a better harvest.  Her goal for the future is to provide her children with the best lifestyle possible and help them to on to establish professional careers.

This is her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She's never had any other loan through state banks, and FUDECOSUR has given her good payment terms at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for coffee production

loans.name: Willian

texts.es:
William V. M., está casado, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su cafetal y tenerlo en buenas condiciones  este año. Él cuenta con el terreno ya en producción, que está en buenas condiciones además cuenta con  la experiencia en el manejo de este desde ya varios años. Lo que el quiere es incrementar la producción de su plantación para  tener más rendimiento en calidad como cantidad de café y crecer como un caficultor de la zona en buena producción este año. El piensa en su futuro y en la de su familia, quiere brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, al igual lograr unas metas propuestas para crecer como persona y como productor.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
William V. M. is married living with his wife and two children who are his main priority.  He wants to buy necessary supplies for his coffee crops to have them in good condition this year.  He has a field already in production that’s in good condition.  He also has several years experience growing coffee.  

What he wants to do is increase production to have higher yields both in quantity and quality of coffee and to grow as a coffee producer in the zone with a good harvest this year.  He thinks of his and his family’s future and wants to provide them with better quality of life as well as meeting some goals he has set up for himself to grow as a person and as a producer.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn’t had any previous loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR provided the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio A. M., está casado y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar algunas herramientas para la fabricación de muebles que le hacen falta en su ebanistería. El cuenta con varios años de experiencia en la fabricación de muebles de todo tipo y lo que él quiere es mejorar su nivel de calidad de trabajo y servir o cumplir a sus clientes con un mejor acabado de un nivel más alto, dándole más precisión a sus trabajos y finura. El  quiere es generar ganancias para su bienestar familiar,  al igual para invertir más en su pequeño taller e ir creciendo en el área hasta poder llegar a tener más demanda de sus productos.
Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio A. M. is married living with his wife who is his greatest priority.  He wants to buy a few tools to make furniture that he needs for his cabinet making shop.  He has several years experience making all kinds of furniture.  He’d like to improve the level of quality of his work and provide his customers with better finishings of a higher level providing his items with more precision and fine touches.  He wants to generate better profits for his family’s wellbeing as well as to invest in his small workshop to grow in the area thus creating more demand for his products.

This is his second loan from FUDECOSUR.   He hadn’t had previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR provided the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy cabinet making tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farming supplies for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando V. M., está casado, tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad al igual que su señora esposa. El quiere comprar abonos y realizar unos trabajos que le faltan a su cafetal, por lo cual tiene que pagar la mano de obra de estas mejoras. El pretende mejorar su cafetal en todas las condiciones que se puedan para tenerlo más desarrollado y así obtener mejores cosechas de la plantación este año. El piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y la de su esposa por lo cual está realizando cada día mejoras a su plantación para cada vez obtener más ingresos de ella y así ir creciendo su nivel de vida y ofrecerle a sus hijos una mayor comodidad para que lleguen a ser unos profesionales algún día.  
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Orlando V. M. is married and has three children who, together with his wife, are his greatest priority.  He wants to buy manure and to finish some pending jobs in his coffee plantation so needs to pay labor costs to accomplish them.  He intends to improve all his coffee plantation’s conditions so that it will be better developed and thus obtain improved harvests this year.  

He thinks of his wife’s and children’s future so is always improving his crops daily in order to obtain more income from them thus improving their standard of living and providing his children with more comfort so that they will become professionals some day.

This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He hasn’t had previous loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy coffee farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Lidia; La socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia  es conviviente; la socia tiene 3 hijos de (12,10,1) años de edad; la socia trabaja en artesanía, ella realiza textiles, chompas de alpaca, desde el año 2000, la socia trabaja elaborando y vendiendo a todos los turistas que vienen a visitar el bello pueblo típico de Chinchero. La socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de materiales, ella comprara lanas de alpaca, tintes naturales, lanas sintéticas, de oveja, palitos para tejer, botones de todo tamaño, agujas gruesas entre otros materiales de costura y tejido. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para los textiles.                                   
La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Lidia is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Victoria – Chinchero” which is located in the District of Chinchero, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 12, 10, and 1). Lidia is an artisan who makes fabrics out of alpaca wool. Since 2000, she has been making and selling fabrics to all the tourists who visit the beautiful town of Chinchero. Lidia wants to invest her loan in the purchase of materials. She plans to buy alpaca wool, natural dyes, synthetic wool, sheep’s wool, knitting needles, buttons in all sizes, darning needles, and other supplies used for sewing and weaving. Lidia is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of these materials for making fabrics.

She is happy with the loan being provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To invest in materials and supplies for making fabrics.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca C. es de la ciudad de Carapegua – compañía Cerrito, tiene 40 años, es madre soltera, cuenta con casa propia y tiene 2 hijos; un hijo de 15 años y una hija de 8 años. 
La Sra. Blanca se dedica al comercio de ropas en forma ambulante(macatera) hace más de 5 años; aprendió este trabajo desde muy joven tejiendo frazadas en su domicilio para otras personas quienes llevaban a vender sus productos; viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso mejor decidió dedicarse a la venta por otras ciudades.
Fue así que empezó a trabajar como macatera y hoy día cuenta con más de 50 clientes activos contando con un ingreso semanal considerable.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de ropas, su posterior venta y obtener así un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca C. is from the neighborhood of Cerrito in the city of Carapgeua. She is 40 years old, lives in her own home, and has two children: a 15 year old son and an 8 year old daughter.

Sra. Blanca has been selling clothes as a traveling merchant for more than five years. She learned this trade as a young woman by producing woven blankets from her home along with other people who sold these products. Since she needed to earn a better income, Blanca decided to sell in other cities.

She started working as a traveling saleswoman and today she has more than fifty regular customers. Blanca is able to generate a considerable weekly income. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes for subsequent resale so that she generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase blankets, trousers, shirts, blouses, and other products to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Divinas De San Mateo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LAS DIVINAS DE SAN MATEO". Esta ubicado en Hidalgo, en México. Esta conformado por 13 personas. La señora Paula A. M. es integrante del grupo, tiene 48 años, estudio hasta la primaria, es comerciante y tiene 3 hijos, 1 mujer y 2 varones. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catálogo desde hace 15 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en mercancia para su negocio de cosmeticos, y de esta forma hacer crecer sus negocios. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base al crédito piensa hacer mayores inversione en su negocio y de esta forma comenzar a tener más ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida, a ella y a toda su familia, y es por eso que, debido a sus altos indices de ventas estan por acenderla lo que le permitira tener una gran variedad de clientes en distintas localidades y logre sus objetivos.
texts.en: This group is named Las Divinas de San Mateo (The Divine Ones from San Mateo). It is located in Hidalgo, Mexico. It is made up of 13 people. Señora Paula is an important member of the group. She is 48 years old and attended elementary school. She is a storekeeper and has three children, one woman and two men. She has been selling cosmetics through catalogs for the past 15 years. She requests this loan in order to invest in more merchandise for her cosmetics business and in this way, to expand her business. Upon requesting this loan, she feels excited by the prospect of being able to make more investments in her business and in this way to begin to make more money that will allow her to create a better quality of life for herself as well as for all of her family. It is because of this, owing to her high sales indices that are about to increase, that will allow her to have a wide variety of clients in different neighborhoods and to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise.

loans.name: La Cuadrita De Mi Barrio Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su Octavo ciclo. Tiene por nombre "La cuadrita de mi barrio".
Podemos mencionar la historia de la Sra. Maria Teresa F., quien tiene 45 años de edad, de profesión modista, confecciona ropas y sábanas; tiene su casa en una villa en la zona de San Antonio en la ciudad de Asuncion, como tiene su clientela formada su sueño es ampliar su taller de costura, ya que sus hijas también saben confeccionar y se dedican al mismo oficio.
Ella dice que si uno se pone una meta, con esfuerzo puede lograr alcanzarla.
texts.en:
This existing committee is in its eighth loan cycle and has the name “La Cuadrita de Mi Barrio” (The Little Corner of My Neighborhood).

The story being presented is that of Sra. Maria Teresa F.. She is 45 years old and a seamstress by profession. Maria makes clothing and bed sheets. She has a house in a section of the city of Asuncion in the San Antonio District where she also has an established customer base. Her dream is to expand her sewing workshop. Her daughters also know how to sew and are devoted to the same trade. She says that if she sets a goal for herself, she puts forth great effort to achieve it.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en el distrito de La Matanza en la región de Piura, unas cuatro horas de Chiclayo, la capital de Lambayeque. 

Desde más de 10 años, gana su vida como obrero de campo. Con este trabajo, puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Es muy conocido en su negocio y en la región donde vive. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos a ella lo que ayudará mejorar la condición de la vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Posee buenas referencias laborales y personales de su comunidad. Es responsable y ha cumplido con sus obligaciones de otros préstamos en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Jesús is 54 years old, married, and has two dependent children. He lives in the District of La Matanza in the region of Piura, which is approximately four hours away from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque.

Jesús has worked as a field laborer for more than ten years. With his job, he is able to cover the family expenses. Jesús is well-known for his work in the region where he lives. At the moment, his house is in a state of deterioration. He wants to make a few repairs to help improve his family’s living conditions. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. Jesús possesses good personal and work-related references from the community. He is responsible and has satisfied his other loan obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: To make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es:
La señora Victoriana R. tiene 58 años de edad, está casada desde hace tiempo y tiene hijos ya mayores de edad independientes económicamente. Vive en su propia casa que está situada en el Barrio Pacú Cua de Encarnación.
La señora Victoriana se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de mercaderías de primera necesidad tales como: harina, fideos, yerbas, vinos en caja y otros, tiene muchos clientes de la zona a quienes les trae mercaderías por pedidos. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido salir adelante, educar a sus hijos y mantener su hogar.
Por ello solicita el crédito, para poder abastecer mejor su pequeño comercio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoriana R. is 58 years old and has been married for some time. Her children are grown and financially independent. She lives in her own home in the neighborhood of Pacú Cua in Encarnación.

For some time Sra. Victoriana has been selling basic necessities such as flour, noodles, herbs, cases of wine, and other products. She has many customers in the area who want the merchandise they order delivered to them. Thanks to this business, Victoriana has been able to move forward, educate her children, and maintain her home.

She is requesting this loan so that she can better stock her small business and fulfill the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase flour, noodles, herbs, cases of wine, and other products.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas” tiene  más de 2 años de formación y trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 2 señoras que emprenderán nuevos negocios sólo después de obtener el crédito.
La sra. Estela M. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, panificados, bebidas, etc. para poder mantenerse ella misma y a su familia; desde hace mucho tiempo desea poder aumentar la cantidad de productos ofertados en su puesto de venta, por eso solicita el crédito para poder realizarlo.
Todas las integrantes anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan más de lo necesario para facilitarles los recursos para su desarrollo y formación integral.
texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas” (Women Working Together) has been in existence for more than two years and continues to work with Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of its members engage in productive businesses, but the group also includes two women who will start their own ventures after they obtain their loans.  

Sra. Estela M. sells fruits and vegetables, baked goods, beverages, and other products in order to support herself and her family.  For some time she has wanted to expand her vending post, so she is requesting a loan to accomplish this goal.  

All of the members hope for a better future for their children.  For this reason, they double their efforts to secure what they need to grow and develop.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, baked goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia R. owns A Plus Real Estate Services.  She has been a real estate agent for the past 30 years, and a real estate broker for the last two.  Lydia got into the real estate business after buying her first home.  She says a poor understanding of the business side of home buying made her feel vulnerable throughout the process and motivated her to educate herself.  She took courses in real estate management, which eventually led to her becoming a certified real estate agent.  Lydia holds a bachelors degree from Texas State University, from which she graduated Summa Cum Laude in 2005.

Being a certified real estate broker means she has the credentials to manage her own real estate business without operating through a middleman.  Lydia has a small office with a conference room where she can meet with clients.  She says that meeting a potential client is much like an interview, and that having an office gives her business professional credibility.  In addition to herself, Lydia currently has one real estate agent that works for A Plus Real Estate.

When Lydia decided to start A Plus Real Estate, she wanted to do it alone, without any outside financing.  This strained her resources.  Early on, she invested too much of the company’s revenues back into the business, assuming she could pay herself with future business transactions.  Overextended, she found herself in a bind when business temporarily slowed.  She soon realized paying cash for everything was not practical, and decided it would be prudent to take out a small loan to help cover operating expenses.

She first heard of ACCION Texas-Louisiana years ago through a San Antonio Express-News article written about the organization and its CEO, Janie Barrera.  Lydia found the article inspiring and saved it.  When she decided to apply for a loan, she remembered the article and decided to apply through ACCION Texas-Louisiana.

Lydia never wants her business to grow to the point that it costs her customers quality of service.  She says she would someday like to have 10 real estate agents with A Plus Real Estate, but says she does not want to overextend herself and wants her business to grow naturally.  This summer, she expects to be ready to hire an additional two agents.

Check out her business at http://www.bestsanantoniodeals.com/.

loans.use: Help covering operating expenses

loans.name: Lovette Kinnie's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Blama, a town in eastern Sierra Leone.   

The teachers of this school have come to SMT for a loan of SLL 5,600,000 in order to improve on their standards of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children, and so on.  At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment amount to repay SMT.   This is the first loan that this group has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. 

Lovette Kinnie B. is the leader of this group of teachers. Lovette is 45 years old and was born in Bialargo in southern Sierra Leone. She is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for the past 32 years. Lovette is married to a farmer and they have 3 children -- 2 of whom are attending secondary school and 1 is no longer attending school. Lovette will use her share of the loan to pay school fees for her children and invest the remainder in her fried cake business. She will buy frying oil and flour in large quantity in order to produce a larger number of cakes for sale.

loans.use: Pay school fees for her children and use the remainder of the loan in her fried cake business

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en el Décimo-Primer ciclo, se llama "Las divinas".
La Sra. Maria R. de 46 años de edad tiene 1 hijo estudiante del nivel terciario, Maria trabaja fuera de su casa  pero los fines de semana ella prepara comestibles y los vende en frente de su casa.
La señora es muy sacrificada y tiene un día a día muy pesado.
Tiene una casita pequeña y desea ampliarla para abrir una despensa y dar buenos ingresos a su hogar; por ello agradece de antemano la ayuda recibida de la  Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, desea refraccionar su pequeña tienda y comprar más comestibles de buena calidad, abasteciendo mejor de esa manera las necesidades de sus clientes, pues además ella es el sostén de la casa.
texts.en:
This existing committee is in its eleventh loan cycle and goes by the name “Las Divinas” (The Divine Ones).

Sra. Maria R. is 46 years old and has one son who is a student at the college preparatory level. Maria works outside of the home, but on the weekends she prepares food and sells it in front of her house. She has made many sacrifices and gets extremely fatigued day after day.

Maria has a small house, but she wants to expand it so that she can open a food pantry and generate a good household income. She expresses her thanks in advance for the assistance she will receive from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. Maria wants to remodel her small store and buy more high quality food products. This will help her do a better job of meeting the needs of her customers since she is the breadwinner in her household.

loans.use: To restock with fruits, vegetables, flour, corn, sugar, baked goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Alianza De La Cascada Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”ALIANZA DE LA CASCADA”, está iniciando su sexto ciclo en el Centro Focal Cascada.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de diez  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora María Magdalena, como tesorera a la señora Agustina, y como secretaria de actas a la señora Sofía.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio.
La presidenta, la señora María Magdalena es una mujer de 48 años de edad, casada y madre de cinco hijos.   La señora María Magdalena tiene  mucha experiencia en el trabajo con asociaciones comunales, antes de formar parte de la asociación comunal  “Alianza de la Cascada”, fue parte de otras asociaciones comunales en Pro Mujer, su primera experiencia fue en 1993. Con relación al negocio que realiza, comentó que desde hace veinte años elabora el tejido artesanal de mantas, su hermana le enseñó a realizar este trabajo.   Con el monto de crédito solicitado piensa comprar lana de vicuña y alpaca, materia prima para la elaboración de las mantas. La lana de vicuña y alpaca, puede ser adquirida en la Feria 16 de Julio en la Ciudad de El Alto.  La venta de las mantas producidas es realizada en esta feria también, los días jueves y domingo de siete de la mañana hasta las doce y media del medio día, cuando es necesario sus hijos le ayudan en la venta de las mantas.  
Cuando le consultamos a la señora María Magdalena qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde compartir con las compañeras, el “ahorro” y la “capacitación” porque aprendemos.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Alianza de La Cascada” is starting its sixth loan cycle as part of the Cascada Community Center. This group consists of ten members. Its Board of Directors consists of the following members: Sra. María Magdalena – President, Sra. Augustina – Treasurer, and Sra. Sofía – Sectretary of Records. These women have businesses in different sectors such as trade, manufacturing, and services.

The president, Sra. María Magdalena, is a 48 year old woman. She is married and the mother of five children. Sra. María Magdalena has plenty of experience working with groups prior to joining “Alianza de La Cascada” since she was a member of other Communal Associations with Pro Mujer. Her first experience occurred in 1993. With regard to her business, María Magdalena says that she has been producing woven blankets for twenty years. Her sister taught her this trade. The amount of her loan request will be used to buy vicuña and alpaca wool, the material she uses to make blankets. She acquires the vicuña and alpaca wool at the July 16th Fair in the city of El Alto. Her finished blankets are also sold at the fair on Thursdays and Sundays between 7am and 12:30pm. When necessary, her children help with selling blankets.

When asked what she enjoys most about Pro Mujer, Sra. María Magdalena indicated that she likes sharing with the other group members, the savings account, and the training classes because she is able to learn.

loans.use: To purchase vicuña and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Las Frutillitas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “LAS FRUTILLITAS”, está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Santiago II. Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora María Magdalena, como tesorera la señora Mónica, y como secretaria de actas a la señora Natividad.  Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos:   venta de verduras, venta de papel higiénico, jaboncillo y otros enseres de limpieza, tienda de abarrotes, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa tejida para bebé, costura de buzos para niño.
La señora María Magdalena, presidenta de la A.C. “LAS FRUTILLITAS”  es una mujer joven de 20 años de edad, a la fecha se encuentra casada, no tiene hijos.  Su experiencia de trabajo en asociaciones comunales es de seis meses, ella comenta que ingresó a la asociación por invitación.   Desde hace dos  años trabaja en la venta de cosméticos, también, tiene un minibús (ella y su esposo).  El trabajo de venta de cosméticos es realizado todos los días de forma ambulante.  El minibus es conducido por su esposo y ella le apoya cuando tiene la oportunidad.  Como muchas personas, en la familia se cuenta con más de un negocio para cubrir los gastos del hogar y pensar en planificar un futuro para los niños que vendrán.  La señora María Magdalena espera que el crédito le permita comprar llantas para el minibús.
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, la señora María Magdalena  responde la “atención”.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “LAS FRUTILLITAS” ["The Little Strawberries"] is starting its first loan cycle at the Santiago II service center. This communal bank includes eight members. The executive board is made up of María Magdalena as president, Mónica as treasurer, and Natividad as secretary.  The women have different businesses, including: selling vegetables; selling bathroom tissue, soap and other hygiene products; operating a grocery store; selling cosmetics; selling woven baby clothing; and tailoring jackets for children. 

María Magdalena, president of “LAS FRUTILLITAS,” is a young woman of 20. At present, she is married and has no children. She has six months of experience with communal associations, and she comments that she joined the group by invitation. For the past two years, she has worked selling cosmetics. She also has a minibus (together with her husband). She works every day selling cosmetics as a mobile vendor. The minibus is driven by her husband, and she helps him when she has the chance. Like many others, their family has more than one business to cover their household expenses and with their thoughts toward planning for the future of the children who will come. María Magdalena hopes that the loan will allow her to buy tires for the minibus. 

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, María Magdalena responds "the service."

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia, de 48 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus dos hijos mayores que trabajan y se mantienen; juntos luchan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 14 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica al alquiler de dos puestos en un mercado de su zona. Dice que se los compró con un dinero que recibió por la venta de un terreno  y desde entonces ha aprovechado muy bien la zona comercial. Pero es consciente con los jóvenes inquilinos y por esta razón no les cobra mucho, pues como ella, así empezó como comerciante y sabe como es el tipo de negocio. Paralelamente también se dedica a la venta de productos energizantes (Herbalife) y le pagan no solo por el volumen de sus ventas sino también por captar a nuevas vendedoras. Ella tiene planeado instalar una tienda amplia de venta de productos energizantes, donde pueda realizar sus reuniones de vendedoras. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Patricia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la refacción de uno de sus puestos, pues esta algo deteriorado  y también quiere comprar algunos productos energizantes para tenerlos en stock, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Patricia, 48, lives in her own house with her two adult children who work and support themselves; together they struggle to get ahead.

For the last 14 years this enterprising woman has leased out two stands in a local market.  She says she bought them with money she got from the sale of a piece of property and since then she’s taken good advantage of the commercial zone.  But she’s conscious of her young tenants and for this reason doesn’t charge them too much because, like her, this is how she started as a merchant and she knows what this type of business is like.

At the same time, she sells energizing products (Herbalife).  She is paid not only for the volume of sales she makes but also for the number of new saleswomen she can recruit.  She plans to set up a roomier store to sell her energizing products where she can hold her meetings with her sales team.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to repay on time because she doesn’t want to disappoint the people who made the loan possible that will allow her to say in business in search of progress.

Patricia plans to use the requested loan to refurbish one of her stands because it’s a bit deteriorated and she also wants to buy some of the energizing products to have in stock to get ahead this way.

loans.use: To refurbish her stands and to buy energizing products.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie C. and her husband Offie own 3rd Eye Surveillance, through which they sell, design, and service surveillance equipment.  Now in its seventh year of operations, 3rd Eye Surveillance has grown beyond its founders to include an additional full-time employee and four independent contractors.  Besides selling surveillance systems, 3rd eye surveillance also sells pepper spray and other violence-deterring products.

At first, the majority of 3rd Eye Surveillance’s business came from installing security systems at apartment complexes.  Offie ran the business, while Marie had another full-time job that helped support themselves and their two children.  When Marie quit her job to help run 3rd Eye Surveillance, she helped make their business HUB-certified (Historically Underutilized Businesses).  She says this certification makes them eligible for government contracts, and makes them more attractive to large corporations.

Marie and Offie want to start selling security systems wholesale to other independent contractors and have the contacts in place to begin importing.  They need financing to help them with the high start-up costs.  Because Marie and Offie had been paying cash for their purchases, their credit score kept them from getting a loan from commercial banks.  Marie is using this loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana to build her credit score, so that she can qualify for a larger loan this summer.  She and Offie ultimately want to receive financing so that they can begin importing surveillance systems to sell wholesale.

Marie and Offie donate and install free surveillance systems for organizations that need added security but lack the resources to pay.  For example, they donated and installed a surveillance system for the Genesis Women’s Shelter.  They have also donated surveillance systems to churches and retirement homes.

Check out their website at http://www.3rdeyesurveillance.net/index.html.

loans.use: To build credit

loans.name: Libelulas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Libelulas" se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México esta integrado por 10 clientas una de las integrantes es la señora Maria Teresa M., tiene 45 años de edad, estudio la educacion secundaria, tiene 25 años de casada con el señor Sergio V. con quien tiene 4 hijas el señor es chofer desde hace mas de 10 años, ella comenta que el prestamo lo utilizará para poder incrementar sus ventas en su negocio de loncheria comprando insumos para la elaboracion de comida y muebles para la comodidad de sus clientes, ademas de poder ofrecer una variedad de comida, así lograr obteniendo mas ingreso y apoyor a su marido con los gastos de su familia. La señora Maria esta muy agradecida por el apoyo para cumplir sus sueños. Observaciones la señora que no se ve bien en la foto se llama Rita M..
texts.en: This group is called "Las Libelulas" [The Dragonflies]. It is located in the state of México. It is made up of 10 clients. One of the members is Ms. Maria Teresa M.. She is 45 years old and went to junior high school. She has been married for 25 years to Mr. Sergio V., with whom she has 4 daughters. He has been a driver for more than 10 years. She says that she will use the loan to be able to increase her sales at her business, which is a lunch place. She will buy ingredients to make food and furniture for her customers' comfort, in addition to being able to make a variety of foods. Tthus she will obtain more income and support her husband with the family expenses. Maria is very grateful for the support to make her dreams come true. Note: the woman who can't been seen very well in the photo is named Rita M..

loans.use: to buy ingredients and furniture for her lunch place.

loans.name: Mercedes Adilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Adilia es casada, tiene dos hijos uno de 10 y otro de 5 años de edad, los cuales estudian primaria y preescolar respectivamente, la Sra. Doña Adilia cuenta con la ayuda del Marido que trabaja como Geologo en las Minas de La libertad, ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, el cual tambien obtiene ingresos de venta de productos de cosmeticos.  
Solcita ayuda a Kiva a quien desde ya agradece por esta oportunidad brindada, ya que necesita un credito para mejora la infraestructura de su Vivienda como es cambian techo y ponerle piso.  
Su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda digna y con buenas condiciones de vida, a las vez que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada dia
texts.en:
Adilia is married and she has two children; one is 10 years old and the other is 5 years old.  They are in primary school and preschool respectively. Adilia has her husband's support. He works as a geologist at the La Libertad mines. She is a very responsible and hardworking person.  She also earns an income through the sale of cosmetic products. 

She requests Kiva's support and she is thankful for their support. She needs a loan to improve the infrastructure of her house. She will change the roof and she will install flooring.

Her greatest dream is to have a dignified place to live and a good quality of life. She also wants to never have her children go without their daily meals.

loans.use: to change the roof and to install a floor in her house

loans.name: Carlos Cesar

texts.es: carlos césar fernández M. tiene 44 años, es soltero no tiene hijos y vive en casa de sus padres, es mecánico automotriz de profesión y conforme realizaba sus prácticas profesionales fue inclinándose para la parte eléctrica de los vehículos es así como el ahora cuenta con un taller propio y adicional a esto lleva trabajando 7 años en el instituto catalina buendía de pecho como docente en la especialidad de mecánica eléctrica, tiene su taller propio el cual lo pudo poner con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, sus principales clientes son vecinos de la zona, él los atiende con gran calidez. este negocio le ha permitido obtener mayores ingresos que le sirven para los gastos de la casa, ya que él es el sustento de sus padres, Carlos desea invertir en compra de instrumentos para una mejor calidad de atención y efectividad en los diagnósticos que realiza, teniendo como resultado la captación de mayor cantidad de clientes, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago, el sueño de carlos es tener una taller completo, donde ofrezca la venta de productos y el servicio mecánico, y de esta manera brindarle una buena calidad de vida a sus padres.
texts.en:
Carlos Cesar F. M. is 44 years old. He is single with no children and lives with his parents. He currently works as an auto mechanic; he works primarily on the electrical part of vehicles and has his own shop. He has also worked as a teacher of electric mechancis at the Catalina Buendia de Pecho Institute for the past seven years.

He has his own shop, in which he invests much effort and work. His principal clients are neighbors in the area, whom he serves with great quality. This business has allowed him to have more income that help him with household expenses, since he supports his parents. Carlos would like to invest in the purchase of instruments to be able to offer better quality and effectiveness in his diagnostics. He is being offered the credit based on good personal references and his ability to pay the monthly quotas. Carlos' dream is to have a fully equipped shop where he can offer the sale of products as well as mechanical servcies, and in this way offer a better quality of life to his parents.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and car accessories

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a restaurant. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her restaurant business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 24,500 to purchase raw materials. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 24,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Vicenta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Munhzaya

texts.en:
Munhzaya, 27, is married and lives with her husband and a daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her father's backyard. Her husband operates a taxi service and her daughter goes to kindergarten. 

Munhzaya began operating a food trading stall in 2010. She started her business with a loan of 800,000 MNT. Her business runs well but the loan interest was too high and she had to pay most of her income toward the interest.   Her husband earns good money from his taxi service and helps her operate her business, and their combined family income is enough to support their family needs.   

Munhzaya has gained enough experience to expand her business. She has finished paying her loan back but her current working capital is not enough to continue her business. She is a hardworking and polite person who says, "I would like to save money for my daughter's further education and to be able to give her a good education".  She is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more food in her business in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To stock food to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a 49-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store in the province of Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Anita is borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she could increase her working capital and be able to buy more merchandise to sell in her sari-sari (general) store and therefore increase her income capacity. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Anita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell in the general store

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann C. is a seventy-year-old married woman from the province of Kompong Cham.  She earns a living by growing rice. She has been farming since 1979 and makes approximately $1 per day to support her family.  Her husband assists her in the same business. This couple has six children -- three are single and three are married. Two of their children are working at a garment factory as sewing workers. Vann C. is looking for a loan to buy a cow because her old cow can no longer support her field work.

loans.use: To buy a cow to replace the old one for field work

loans.name: Consolatres

texts.en: Consolatres is a married woman who lives in the province of Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and food production - making Chorizo sausages. Her husband Samuel,  works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 17 years old. Consolatres joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Consolatres has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to purchase feed for the pigs and also purchase ingredients for her Chorizo production so that she can continue to save up for her child’s education and support household needs. Consolatres is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase feed and ingredients for Chorizo production

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun S. is 39 years old and has two children who are single and still living under her care. At the beginning of 2008, Yun S. has built a small wooden store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells snack products, perfume, soft drinks, cooking ingredients and other products to sell to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. She is married to Mey Somrorl, 37, an internal staff at HALO organization, in Kompong Cham province. In order to earn extra profit and make the business more successful, recently, the part of Yun S.’s item has been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan to accumulate amount of her inventory to continue selling.

loans.use: to buy more snacks, perfumes, soft drinks and cooking ingredients to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn M. is from the village of San Antonio, Cabisera 18, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Marilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn plants and harvests rice for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 32000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for rice farm

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun V., aged 45, is a mother blessed with nine children. She was once married, but had been divorced from her husband since her children were still young. She currently earns income by growing rice crops, while one of her sons works in construction. 

Soeun V. has inherited a piece of farmland from her grandparents. In addition, she hopes to grow various other crops on her own land.  Soeun V. decided to seek a loan to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies to expand her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and farming supplies

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo B. is from the village of Luyang Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 55 years old. Danilo is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Danilo owns & operates a business selling fruits and vegetables. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is 39 years old.  He lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a two-bedroom studio apartment. Ganbat’s two older sons are attending the local secondary school and the youngest son is just one year old. His wife Uranjargal, 26, is a doctor. 

Ganbat has been running a kimchi factory for the last three years with 2 employees. He worked in a kimchi factory when he was in Korea. He is dedicated to supplying his customers with his own label quality products by paying close attention to taste, quality and hygiene. He is a very optimistic person who wants to improve his family’s living condition and is planning to have his own working place.  He also wants to give his children a good education and teach them morals.

Ganbat plans to use the loan he is asking for to purchase plastic bags to use in his business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bags for kimchi production factory

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s service station business. He started this business 10 years ago and provides car and motorbike washing services to his clients. Rani is hopeful that an investment will be good for him and it will improve his business condition. Her husband will buy engine oils, filters, shampoos and polishers by utilizing the loan. Rani is the mother of two sons. Both sons work in private organizations. 

She lives in Lahore, which is Pakistan’s second largest city, known for its history and culture. She lives there in the area of Youhanabad with her family in a single-room brick house. She moved here 10 years ago. She is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very supportive lady and is always ready to help her family in time of need. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and she hopes it will be turned into a long-term relationship.

loans.use: To buy engine oil, filters, shampoo and polisher

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano A. is from the village of Olango, Mallig, Isabela. He is 49 years old. Victoriano is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Victoriano owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Victoriano has been engaged in his business for over 35 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Victoriano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoriano is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Victoriano from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Bashraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashraan lives in Lahore, which is Pakistan’s second-largest city and known for its history and culture. She has lived with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Youhanabad for the past 15 years.

Her husband’s name is H. M. and he operates an electronics sales shop. He sells different electronics items like juicers and irons on installments to his customers. By selling products on easy installments, people are able to buy goods that they can’t afford to buy with cash outright.

Bashraan is the mother of 2 daughters and a son. Her eldest daughter operates a beauty salon at home and her other children are getting their education. Bashraan herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very caring mother and is raising her children with good care.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy some electronics to put to his shop to sell on installments to his customers. He has operated this business for the past 10 years and Bashraan is hopeful that an investment will be profitable one for him. 

Bashraa is a new loan applicant of Asasah. She is hopeful about her family’s better financial future.

loans.use: To buy electronics to resell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is a married woman who lives in Puerto Princesa, Palawan. She earns her living by selling meat/dressed chicken and fish.   Her husband Michael, who is 30 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are between 2 and 9 years old. Melanie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melanie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 26,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 22nd loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to buy more stocks to sell and raw materials for her new business (piggery) so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her  businesses, to have her own lot and finish the studies of her children. Melanie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem O. and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Sun, have been married for almost 30 years and have eight children-three sons and five daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, five are garment factory workers and other two are in school. They are living on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sem and her husband are farmers. They grow many kinds of vegetable such as corn, tomato and seas am on her farmland in the village. Sem is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to repair the house where he lives and building a restroom for family use.
Photo: Mrs. Sem O. was at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives and build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan P. is from the village of Olango, Mallig, Isabela. He is 33 years old and married, with an infant child. To make a living, Jonathan plants and harvests rice for sale. Jonathan has been engaged in his business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP a month.

Jonathan joined ASKI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonathan is requesting his first loan, for 20000 PHP, to be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jonathan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthea V. (pictured here) is 29 years old and her husband, Mr. Ravy Oeurn is 24 years old. They have been married since 2006 and have one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young. They are living on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Kunthea stays at home and takes care of her children. The main source of income is from her husband’s business. He is a wooden house builder. Kunthea is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business

loans.name: Busadykan's Group

texts.en:
Busadykan A. is the treasurer of this group. She is a resident of Nookat, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 55 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has brought up a daughter and a son. The son went to work in Russia to make money and the daughter is married and lives separately with her family.

Busadykan herself works as a teacher in a kindergarten. In order to earn additional money, the family breeds cattle. With money received from the loan Busadykan wants to purchase a cow for breeding. In the future she wants to start repairing her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyneang C. (pictured here) is 33 years old and her husband, Mr. Ratana Khut is 43 years old. They have been married since 2002 and have two young children--one son and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.
 
Sreyneang has been a silk weaver for ten years. Her husband is a security guard. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia B. is from the village of Sta. Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 61 years-old. Lydia is a widow with five adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2011, Lydia joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lydia from ASKI.
