She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna C. (in the photo) is 32 years-old and his wife, Mrs. Sotom Soem is 35 years-old.  They have married since 1999 and have two young sons. The family lives in a small village along National Road number five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Veasna is a garment factory worker. His wife sells "sluch" or shaved ice dessert and cake in her village. He hopes to build a new house to live in, but he does not have money. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: to build a new house to live in

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia Elizabeth S. L. de 34 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive junto a su compañero de vida, y dos hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad. Sonia posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Este negocio es el cual le ha permitido poder contar con ganancias extras lo que le brinda la ayuda necesaria tanto a su esposo como a ella para pagar su casa a tiempo, y así mismo contar con los alimentos y todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Es por esto que Sonia desea contar con más productos en la tienda, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lácteos y otros. Esto es muy importante para Sonia ya que cuenta con varios clientes fijos, y otros potenciales, por esto que debe contar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes y así ganar otros más los cuales prefieran comprar en su negocio.
texts.en: Sonia Elizabeth S. L. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Soyapango, in the department of San Salvador. She lives together with her life partner and two children, aged 14 and 9. Sonia owns a store in which she sells perishable products and necessities for the home. This business has made it possible for her to receive extra earnings, which provides her and her husband with the necessary funds to make their house payments on time, and also to have food and other things they need to live with dignity. For this reason, Sonia would like to stock her store with more products, and thus she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, and others. This is very important for Sonia, since she has a number of steady customers and others who are potential customers; for this reason, she needs to have everything that is necessary to satisfy her customers and attract others who will prefer to shop at her store.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell

loans.name: Zaib-Un-Nisa's Group

texts.en:
Zaib-un-Nisa lives in Depalpur which is a small city in Punjab Province, Pakistan. Her house is located in a small colony named Fazal elahi where she has been living, along with her family, in a two room brick house for the past five years. 

She has a six year-old daughter who has yet not started attending school. 

Zaib is very supportive person. She shares the financial burden with her husband by doing a private job. Her husband, whose name is W. I., also does a private job. 

They both are very hardworking persons. After the day job, she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well and takes care of her family. 

Her uncle, who also lives with Zaib and her family, operates a grocery shop in the nearby market. Through his shop he sells daily use items such as  cooking oil, salt, sugar etc to customers. 

He is short of stock these days and therefore Zaib has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially support her uncle in improving his business condition. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to add variety to his shop and to fulfill customer needs on timely basis. Zaib is hopeful that a loan investment will help him increase his profits by putting more stock in his shop.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery shop business

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy S. is from the village of Olango, Mallig, Isabela. She is 44 years-old. Ludy is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ludy owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ludy has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Ludy joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ludy is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ludy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeurn U. (in the photo) is 43 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap SU., is 56 years old.  They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children:  a son and two daughters. Two are in school and the third assists her mother in the business. 

Saroeurn is a taxi driver. His wife sells dessert in her village. In addition, she also rents a space of her house to garment factory workers because her house is located near a garment factory. She wants to build more rooms to rent and also repair the old rooms because they have broken down in some parts. 

Therefore, Saroeurn is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help finance his wife's plans.

loans.use: to provide money to his wife to repair and build more rooms to rent

loans.name: Verónica Del Carmen

texts.es: Verónica del Carmen G. M., reside en Ilopango, junto a su único hijo de 7 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a su esposo. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos comestibles y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Desde ya hace varios años que cuenta con este negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar, así como para poder pagar la mensualidad de su casa. Verónica solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir aún más en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de productos que ya posee y  agregando otros los cuales sus clientes solicitan. Para Verónica es de mucha importancia mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y así mismo sus ganancias ya que es ella es una persona muy responsable que vela por el bienestar de su hogar y el de su hijo, a quien con muchos esfuerzos está logrando darle todo lo necesario.
texts.en: Verónica del Carmen G. M. lives in Ilopango with her husband and their 7 year old son who is a student.  She has a store where she sells groceries and basic items for the home.  She started this business many years ago and it has provided for their needs at home and in paying the monthly rent for their house.  Verónica is asking for a loan to stock even more products in her store, buying a larger quantity of products she already has and adding those that her customers have requested.  It is very important to her that she improve her business and increase her earnings.  She is a very responsible person and watches over the well-being of her home and her son.  With a lot of hard work she is able to give him everything he needs.

loans.use: stock more items in her store

loans.name: Adahamjon's Group

texts.en:
Adahamjon A., a the member of this group, is 24 and lives in Nookat, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 8000 soms, Adahamjon started a business providing video services (shooting and editing). He currently earns 30000 soms per month from this venture. To fill the the large volume of his current orders in a timely manner, Adahamjon hopes to obtain a loan to purchase more video cassettes. In the future he wants to buy a new updated video camera.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase video cassettes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds to plant

loans.name: Delgersaikhan

texts.en: Delgersaikhan N. is 34 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent.  His wife is a hair dresser. Delgersaikhan operates a taxi service in the city.  In the mornings, he works at a foreign language center as a driver.  He has been operating his taxi for 11 years and has gained much experience. He is an energetic person who would like to be able to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for his children.  He is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase some spare parts for his car and to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Pedrina

texts.es: Pedrina G. D. E. D. 63 años D. edad, resiD. en Guazapa, en el departamento D. San Salvador, en donD. vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura, así mismo vive junto a dos nietos, quienes se encuentran al cuidado D. Pedrina ya que los padres se encuentran en Los Estados Unidos. Pedrina posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad para el hogar. Este negocio es el cual le ha permitido poder contar con ganancias extras lo que le brinda la ayuda necesaria tanto a su esposo como a ella para pagar su casa a tiempo, y así mismo contar con los alimentos y todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Es por esto que Pedrina desea contar con más productos en la tienda, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo a través del que pueda comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lácteos y otros más los cuales son necesarios en una buena tienda. Esto es muy importante para Pedrina ya que cuenta con mucha competencia en el lugar, es por esto que debe contar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes y así ganar otros más los cuales prefieran comprar en su negocio.
texts.en: Pedrina G. D. E. is 63 years old and lives in Guazapa, in the department of San Salvador.  She lives with her husband, who works in agriculture, and her two grandchildren, who are under her care and whose parents are in the United States.  Pedrina has a store where she sells groceries and basic supplies for the home.  This business has provided her with the extra income that helps them pay for their house on time and also buy food and other necessities for daily life.  Pedrina is asking for a loan to stock more products in her store.  She will buy rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, and other items any good store needs.  This is very important to her because there is a lot of competition in her area and she needs to have all items in her store to satisfy her customers and attract others who will prefer to shop at her business.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her store

texts.es: María Magdalena M. L. de 26 años de edad, es una joven muy emprendedora y responsable, la cual vive en el municipio de Soyapango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su madre, quien le ayuda con el negocio. María se dedica a la elaboración de alimentos como almuerzos, hamburguesas y tortas, así mismo comercializar jugos, sodas y agua embotellada. Su comedor está ubicado en su casa de habitación, y es gracias a este negocio como ella junto a su madre han salido adelante. María solicita un préstamo a Integral con el enorme deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más insumos como: verduras, granos básicos, frutas, bebidas y otros más, los cuales le aseguran el crecimiento de su negocio, lo cual será de mucho beneficio.
texts.en:
María Magdalena M. L. , 26, is a hardworking and responsible young woman who lives in the town of Soyapango.  Her mother also lives there and she helps her with the business.  Maria makes meals such as lunches, hamburgers and sandwiches, and she sells juices, sodas and bottled water.  Her dining area is in her house and it’s thanks to the business that she and her mother have been able to get ahead.
Maria is requesting a loan from Integral with the great wish to be able to count on the necessary funds to buy ingredients such as: vegetables, basic grains, fruit, drinks and more.  These will assure the growth of her business which will be a big benefit to her.

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients to make lunches

loans.name: Sapani

texts.en:
Age:                            36
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      6
Business:                    selling fried foods in the local community
Loan purpose:              to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale
Weekly profit:              600 WST (US $250)

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.7 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:          1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:               2.25 out of 3

Sapani owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has three years of experience in this business.    Sapani needs a loan of 2,000 WST to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 WST or about $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Sapani joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sapani's 3rd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

texts.es: Miguel Antonio H. A. de 52 años, vive junto a su esposa y un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad, quien depende por completo de Miguel y junto a quienes reside en Apopa. Él es un señor muy responsable, quien trabaja como albañil, oficio que realiza desde hace 30 años atrás, lo que lo hace todo un experto en reparar diferentes objetos. Miguel desea mucho salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar todas las herramientas necesarias como: tornillos, soldadores, llaves y otros más los cuales le permitan hacer más eficiente su trabajo. De esta manera Miguel espera salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Miguel Antonio H. A., age 52, lives with his wife and his little four year old son.  His son is completely dependent upon Miguel.  They live together in Apopa.  

He is a very responsible man who works as a builder.  He has been doing this work for 30 years.  That makes him a complete expert at repairing different things.  Miguel very much wishes to get ahead and offer his family everything they need.

That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  With the loan he will be able to buy the tools he needs like screws, soldering-irons, wrenches, and more.  They will allow him to do his work more efficiently.  That way Miguel hopes to get ahead and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy tools to do his work

texts.en:

She has resided there with her family for the past fifteen years in a two-room brick house in the small colony named Fazal elahi. She is a housewife and stays at home doing her household work. She is a very responsible person and makes the utmost effort to manage all of her responsibilities effectively. 

Her husband’s name is M. T., and he is involved in a stamp papers selling business. Stamp papers are used for any legal documentation. Mujeeb has given birth to two sons. Her eldest son works with his father in his business and supports him in his dealing with his customers while her youngest son is studying in class 8. 

Mujeeb has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son, who wants to start his own stamp papers selling business. He will utilize the loan to buy stamp papers in larger quantities to create a good beginning for his business. This has become Mujeeb’s family business, and she is confident that the loan investment will bring good financial changes to her son's business. 

She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. She is a responsible client and has always paid her loan installments on time.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Mujeeb begum.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris Elizabeth N. R., de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive junto a sus padres, un hermano y 4 hijos: Norma, Gabriela, Berenice y Francisco, quienes dependen económicamente de Doris. Ella se dedica desde hace mas de 15 años a la elaboración de tortillas, localizada sobre una de las principales vías de la capital de El Salvador, conocida como Alameda Juan Pablo Segundo, las hace, tanto al mediodía  como también por las tardes. Lo que garantiza atender a más personas y de esta forma contar con más ventas, lo que es de mucha importancia para ella, debido a que es su única fuente de ingresos, como madre soltera. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para poder comprar: maíz y cal para mejorar sus ventas significativamente. Maíz al por mayor, ya que ya empieza a subir de precios y La Cal, que es un componente usado para cocinar el maíz, se coloca al fuego el maíz junto a la Cal; la proporción que se usa dependerá de si el maíz se quiere para masa que usará en las tortillas o para deliciosos tamales típicos. Realmente gracias a la Cal se logra desprender en su cocción la cascara que trae el grano de maíz, lo limpia. Sin el uso de la Cal, Doris obtendría tortillas con mucha granulación producto de no limpiarlo bien, y sus ventas se verían seriamente disminuidas. 
Uno de los deseos mas grandes de Doris es hacer crecer su negocio y esta segura que con este crédito se impulsará hacia dicho objetivo para que su familia pueda vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Doris Elizabeth N. R. is 43 years old and lives in the state of San Salvador, with her parents, brother and four children: Norma, Gabreila, Berenice and Francisco, who are economically dependent on Doris. For more than 15 years she has made tortillas, in an area located above one of the principal streets in the capital of El Salvador, known as Alameda Juan Pablo Segundo. She makes the tortillas both at noon and in the afternoon, which guarantees a lot of customers and high sales. This is very important to her, as it is her only form of income since she is a single mother. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to purchase maize (corn) and lime to significantly improve her sales.  

Maize and lime prices have recently risen. Lime, an ingredient that is used to cook the maize, is put into the fire along with the maize. The proportion that is used depends on if the maize is being used for tortillas or for delicious traditional tamales.  Thanks to the lime, the maize sheds its shell, and is cleaned. Without the use of lime, Doris would have very grainy tortillas, and her sales would be greatly diminished. 

One of Doris's biggest hopes is to help her business to grow and she is sure that with this loan she will be able to make this happen so that her family can live better.

loans.use: to buy maize (corn) and lime

loans.name: Sheema's Group

texts.en:
Sheema is 41 and a housewife. She got married when she was only 19 years old to A. G., who is a tailor by profession. He is known as an expert in his field and provides his customers good quality services. 

Sheema belongs to Depalpur, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family in the small colony named Fazal Elahi for the past 12 years.
 
She has two sons and a daughter. Her sons had to leave their education early to support the family financially. Her elder son is also a tailor, while her younger son is a bus conductor. Her daughter is getting religious education.
 
Sheema has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s tailoring business. With the loan, he will buy an over-lock machine (a machine to sew over the edge of one or two pieces of cloth for edging). This will enable him to offer this service to his customers. In the past, for this work they used to approach other tailors who had over-lock machines.
 
Sheema is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sheema.

loans.use: To buy an over-lock machine for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat, 32, lives with her husband and three children in a small city of Pakistan called Depalpur. Her home is located in the area named Abdullah Basti and contains two rooms. She came here eight years ago. Her children are young and haven’t started getting education yet. Nusrat takes care of them and also does her household responsibilities very well.
 
She is a business woman and runs a decorative embroidery business in her home for her neighboring clients. She learned this skill from her mother and became accomplished through regular practice. 
 
Her husband's name is M. B. and he operates a donkey cart. He puts different goods like construction supplies and fruits and vegetables on his cart and provides transportaton services to his clients. He has been operating this business for five years.
 
Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He will use the loan to buy a new cart because his old cart has become rough and rotten in different areas and needs a replacement. Nusrat hopes that her husband will be able to do his work better by purchasing a new cart. 
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior by paying her installments on time.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

texts.en:
Maksat A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Nookat, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 54 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised seven sons. Five sons are married, four of them are working in Russia and the others work in a café. 

Maksat and her husband have been engaged in farming for a long time. They cultivate potatoes and corn. By selling part of their harvest they make an additional 7,500 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, Maksat will purchase mineral fertilizers for farming. In the future she wants to see her two younger sons get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina is a married woman who lives in Puerto Princesa, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a vehicle repair shop. Her husband Elpidio, who is 53 years old, works as a welder to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 28 and 32 years old. Catalina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Catalina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase spare parts, materials and supplies that her crew needs to repair the vehicles. She is working hard  so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of the business and to purchase land for their house. Catalina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase  spare parts, materials and supplies necessary to operate her vehicle repair shop

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:

Her primary customers are her neighbors, friends and co-members of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. 

She joined Paglaum MPC in order to avail herself of their credit facilities. She was thankful to Paglaum MPC that her purpose of obtaining additional capital was realized. Now, she applies for PHP 5,000 to buy additional working capital for her sari-sari store business(retail store business). She dreams to own a parcel of land someday.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the resident of Depalpur which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and famous for its dairy industry. Her home is located in the area of Abdullah basti and it contains 3 rooms made up of bricks. She moved here after her marriage with M. A. about 24 years ago. 
She is a 40 year-old housewife, stays at her home does household responsibilities. She is very active and completes her household tasks in a very efficient manner. 

Her husband operates an auto repairing workshop where he can repair from motorbikes to cars. He is known as an expert in his work and has a good number of clients in his area. 

Nasreen has given birth to 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her eldest son is 22 years old and works with his father in his workshop. The second son is a rickshaw driver and her elder daughter operates a clothes sewing business. Her remaining two children are enrolled in a local school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy auto repair tools to offer better quality services to his clients. 

Her husband started this business 5 years ago and Nasreen is confident that the loan will help him further improve his business, which will result in better financial life for her family. 

She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She is a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and has always paid her installments on time. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen”.

loans.use: to buy tools for auto-repair workshop

loans.name: Ronald Ryan

texts.en:

To make a living, Ronald Ryan owns & operates a food stall where he sells soft drinks and other food products in the local community. Ronald Ryan has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business and to pay for the education of his children.

texts.en: Maquinto T. is in her fourth loan cycle and has been able to pay back her loans with no problems. She is  a good member who has been doing her business for many years. She is engaged in food vending, making Puto Conchenta, and other kakanin (Filipino rice snacks). She has a lot of customers because of the good taste of her product. All her children are in school. Her loan will be use to purchase equipment and as additional capital.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger L. is from the town of Plaridel. He is 34 years old and single. To make a living, Roger owns a business selling snacks and other delicacies. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Roger joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Roger is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Roger from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Kipeitwan

texts.en:
Kipeitwan O. K. is 24 years old and married with one child. He is a farmer who has farmed his own piece of land for the last five years.  

He learned about KADET LTD from the KADET staff. This will be his second loan with which he intends to buy farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the living standard and education of his child, as well as for business expansion.

Kipeitwan's dream is to thrive in farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

Genoveva has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Genoveva joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genoveva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Genoveva is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new products to sell to expand her business. This loan will be the Genoveva's fifth loan taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is a married woman who lives in Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a sound and light equipment rental business and selling fish. Her husband Artemio, who is 44 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living.  They have five children who are between 11 and 19 years old. Divina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Divina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000 to buy disco lights and fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. Divina B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase disco lights to rent and fish to sell

loans.name: Pariken

texts.en:
Pariken O., 30 years old and the married father of two children, has been farming on his own piece of land for the last ten years. He learned about KADET LTD from the registered KADET groups and is requesting his second loan after having repaid his previous loan well and in good time. Panken intends to use the entire loan to prepare his wheat farm and hopes to use the profit arising from this loan to improve the living standards for his family.

A hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals, Pariken's dream is to prosper in wheat farming.

loans.use: To prepare his wheat farm.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret, 29 years old, is married to a policeman and the mother of six children, all of whom attend school. Currently in the business of selling bread,  Margret is requesting a loan to stock more bread to sell. With the additional profits accruing from the loan, she hopes to expand her business and build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: Stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four children; two of them are still attending school. He has been working in general trading for 10 years. After gaining the needed experience, he decided to open his own shop in 2007. His work is specialized in buying and selling tinware products. He has obtained two Kiva loans and was very satisfied with the results.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his shop’s inventory in order to expand his business operation. He says that the loan will help him earn higher income. He is very positive about his future plans.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday, who is currently in the business of selling sugar and onions, is 22 years old, married, and has one child who does not yet go to school. Sunday's  loan will be used to stock more sugar and onions to sell. She hopes to change her business system with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more sugar and  onions to  sell.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng L. earns a living by weaving rattan baskets and selling wooden beds. She sells her finished products to her regular customers who come directly to her house. Mrs. Eng L. makes many sets of baskets. Her husband is her partner in running the entire business. They have four teenage children. Two of them go to school, while the other two also weave rattan baskets. Mrs. Eng L. has many clients who purchase her items for resale. She has currently run out of finished products from her stock. She hopes to use the Kiva loan to buy additional beds that she can sell.

loans.use: To buy beds for resale

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Ramzana (shown holding the Asasah Passbook in the picture) is a homemaker with many household responsibilties. She lives in Depalpur, an ancient city famous for its agriculture industry. She and her family live in the area of Abdullah Basti in a two-room brick house, where she and her husband, N. M., moved 30 years ago. Her husband is 50 years old and works as a security guard in a private company. 

Ramzana has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son operates a business of selling stamp papers, which are used for legal documentation. Her second son works as a vegetable seller at market and the youngest is a tailor. Her daughter, the youngest of the children, attends grade 9 at the local school.
 
Ramzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her son’s business. He will utilize the loan by buying stamp papers in larger quantities to offer for sale.

Ramzana is a regular user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. She is a responsible client and has always paid her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy stamp papers (used for legal documentation) to offer for sale

She has been engaged in this business for over six months and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

loans.name: Naimodu Ene

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan which she is planning to use to buy fertilizer and wheat seeds for planting. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. Naimodu repaid the previous loans well and in good time.

Naimodu's dream is to educate her children to university level and expand her farming venture. She is an assiduous woman who is determined to achieve her goals if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and wheat remain

loans.name: Mahabat's Group

texts.en:
Mahabat M., age 39, is the leader of this group. She works in a kindergarten. Mahabat is a resident of Nookat, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She and her husband, who works in construction, have a daughter and a son. The daughter is married and the son is engaged in the family's cattle breeding business, which they started 15 years ago with an initial investment of 1,700 soms in order to earn additional money. 

With the money received from this loan, Mahabat wants to purchase a cow in order to increase their number of cattle. Her hope for the future is to see her son get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: 
– People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
– Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and 
– Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 
MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow
