Lenkoko is 30 years old, married and a father of three children. He farms on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from other men in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, and he plans to use it to buy farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand farming.

Lenkoko's dream is provide better lives to his children. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 30 years old and single. He takes care of one child who is five years old. For two years, he has owned a small restaurant and pub which sells food and drinks. His business is open from 6 am until 12 pm every day and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Jean Marie Vianney has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more food and drinks for his restaurant and pub. He hope to earn more profits. He expects to reinvest his profits in the business.

loans.use: To expand his restaurant and pub

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo C. is from the village of Upper Salimpuno, Concepcion. He is 56 years old. Alfredo is married and has 5 school-aged children. Alfredo raises hogs to sell in the local community as his main source of income. He has been in this business for 6 years with a monthly net income of 3500.00. Being hardworking and properly managing his business make him a successful businessman.

In 2009, Alfredo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and other livestock supplies. This will be the second loan Alfredo has taken out from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed and other livestock supplies

loans.name: Charline

texts.en:
Charline B., age 29, is engaged in a fishing business. She harvests ocean-caught fish and sells these in the local community. Charline has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live in the village of Danao and have three school-aged children. 

In 2003, Charline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Charline has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Charline is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Charline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a married woman who lives in the island of Palawan. She earns her living by operating a rice mill and a general store.  Her husband Rufino, who is 43 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children who are between 2 and 15 years old. Juliet joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Juliet has been incrementally lifting her family's quality of life by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,700, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, so that she could continue sustaining the operations of the rice mill - buy fuel, have enough funds to pay the laborers in the mill, etc. and she also wants to use part of her loan to purchase additional stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future and for the education of her children. Juliet is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy fuel, pay laborers in the rice mill and purchase merchandise to sell in the general store

loans.name: Rahama

texts.en:
Rahama, age 35, is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. She and her husband have five children, all of whom attend school.

Rahama has requested a loan in order to stock more tomatoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business with the extra profits expected from her loan.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, age 40, has a kiosk business. The kiosk is located at the roadside, so it is easy for his customers to access the premises to buy goods to meet their needs. Prior to running the business, Samuel used to do odd jobs to support his family, but the income generated was unstable and sometimes insufficient for meeting the needs of the family. He and his wife Susana, age 36, are blessed with two children: Sami, age 9, who attends third grade in the elementary school, and Arjen, age 5. Samuel and his family live in Naikoten Village in Kupang City.

Samuel began his business using his own small capital. He is happy with his current business, not only because he does not have to look for odd jobs every day but also because he dreams of improving it so as to better provide for his family. Samuel joined TLM Group Lending Program and has received loans in the amount of IDR 500,000 in the first loan cycle and IDR 750,000 in the second. Samuel's business has improved since he received these loans. He used the money to stock more basic materials to be sold in his kioask, such as noodles, coffee, sugar, teabags, soap, detergent, and rice. 

Samuel plans to expand his business by adding more products and to renovate his business place. He is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000. Samuel is hoping that TLM will assist him with a loan to help make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy more products to offer for sale and to renovate his business place

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, age 21, is currently in the business of selling tea. She and her busband, who is smployed as a policeman, have one small child. Their child is as yet too young to attend school.

Monica is requesting a loan in order to stock more tea to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business with the extra profits expected from the loan.

loans.use: to stock more tea to offer for sale

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene, age 35, is the only one in his family who works. For that reason, Damascene works hard in order to provide everything necessary for his family. He owns a small business selling various products such as beans and soap. Damascene has 15 years of experience in htis business. He employs two people from his community as helpers, and his business is well-organized. The hours of his shop are from 6 a.m. until 6:30 p.m. every day.

Damascene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more products for his shop. Damascene hopes to earn more profits, which will allow him to save money for his future and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy products such as beans and soap to sell in his shop

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 56 years old. Lolita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Totu

texts.en:
Totu T., age 32, has been a farmer for eight years. His farm is in a fertile area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming. He and his wife have two children. He learned about KADET Ltd through a marketing campaign offered by Kadet staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, and he intends to use the funds to prepare his wheat farm and purchase farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming in order to increase his wheat production and earn enough to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to become a large-scale farmer, to own a bigger piece of land, and to build a plot. Totu is an energetic man who knows he can do more if supported financially through this loan.

loans.use: to prepare his wheat farm and to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Chhe

texts.en:
Chhe P. has been in the farming business for many years. To earn a living, she plants various crops and typically generates an income of $2.5 per day. She is a widow because her husband died of an illness he had for many years. Currently, she lives with her five children. Two are single, and three are married. 

Chhe Pum has a life partner in her daughter, who makes a profit by selling goods behind Kunpheak Bopha hospital, in Phnom Penh City. She sells plastic products, fast food, soft drinks, napkins, and other necessary goods. Chhe P.’s daughter recently sold out of most of her products. She would like to expand her business but she lacks the funds to make this possible.  Chhe P. will use her loan to assist her daughter to buy essential inventory to sell.

loans.use: To buy essential inventory to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling food/native delicacies and operating a tricycle transport business.  She lives in the island of Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending/native delicacies and tricycle transport businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,600. Charity is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients for her food vending business.  This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Charity aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: purchase ingredienets for the food vending business

loans.name: Umujima

texts.en: Umujima is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions. She is 20 years old and married to a businessman with one child. Her child does not go to school. Umujima borrowed a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel B., age 32, operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, raising pigs in their backyard. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. She is from the village of Taguilon near Dapitan City. She and her husband have four school-aged children. 

In 2009, Mabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for renovating the pig fence that surrounds the animals she tends. 

Mabel is now requesting a second loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase pig feed and additional piglets to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three young children. He works in the Lebanese general security since 1996. In parallel, he operates a van service for students in his village and neighboring towns since 2005. He works hard in both jobs to be able to satisfy alone the demands of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to make much needed repairs to his van, including improving the body and updating the paint. In addition, he will use the loan to register his van and sign the necessary legal papers. He feels positive about his business potential for the coming year.

loans.use: to make much needed repairs on his van and register it

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M., age 61, operates a family member's general store in the village of Sta. Filomena, where she lives. Rosita has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. She and her husband have five adult children. 

In 2007, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase feed for her pigs. 

Rosita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her sari-sari store. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to offer for sale in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en: Renilda is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a carinderia (local eatery) and a fishing business.  Her husband Roy, who is 41 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 7 and 13 years old. Renilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Renilda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 so that she will have enough revolving capital to buy more ingredients and be able to offer a wider variety of food in her carinderia (small restaurant) and she also intends to use part of the loan to sustain her fishing activities. Renilda is working hard so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her businesses. Renilda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn B., age 32, earns her living by raising pigs for breeding. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She is from the village of Rang-Ayan, Mallig, Isabela. Jovelyn and her husband have three school-aged children. 
 
In 2007, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the twelfth loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmer, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. She is 41 years old and a widow with five children and all of them go to school. Margret borrowed a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old and married with three children. Rose owns a small store selling goods such as juice, biscuits etc. This is her fourth successful year in this business. She operates her business from 6 am to 9 pm every day except Sunday. 

Rose currently employs two people to help her. She has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase juice and biscuits in a larger quantity in order to get a better price. Rose will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to accrue savings in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more juice and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, age 30 and married, owns and operates a shop where he sells a variety of goods. Emmanuel has owned his shop for seven years and is well known in his community. The hours of his business are from 7 a.m. until 8 a.m. every day. Emmanuel employs two people in his business.

Emmanuel is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Emmanuel will expand his business by investing in the sale of foodstuffs such as beans, rice, cooking oil, and sugar. He has high hopes that his revenue will increase as a result of such an investment. If successful, Emmanuel will keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability, with the ultimate goal of better providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs such as beans, rice, and sugar, to offer for sale in his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her kids to ride to their work place.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 30 years old and married to a teacher, with one child who goes to school. Janet took out a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia, age 29 (shown holding the "Asasah Passbook" in the picture), is a homemaker with many household responsibilities who resides in Fateh Sher colony, which is located in Sahiwal, an area known for its agriculture industry. She married five years ago, and she and her husband have three small children who are still too young to attend school. The family lives in a two-room brick house. Nazia has great administrative skills and manages her household expenses effectively.
 
Her husband is a fruit vendor who sells fruit at the market. He supplements his income as a daily-wage laborer, taking on jobs whenever they are available. Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits to offer for sale, which will increase his income and sales. 

Nazia is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow further through the investment of this loan. She feels that it will result in a higher standard of living for her family. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. She has proved herself as a responsible client who has always paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for her husband's fruit-vending business

loans.name: Mahabat's Group

texts.en:
Mahabat K. is the leader of this group. She is 36 and married to a farmer. Together they bring up a daughter and a son. Both children are preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money, Mahabat sells milk products. She earns 1,500 soms per month. Her husband earns money by working as a shepherd. He breeds livestock animals. With money received from the loan, Mahabat wants to purchase two sheep in order to increase the number of livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin C. owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in his community. He is 41 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of Malintubuan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Benjamin has been in his business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Benjamin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Benjamin is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his third loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin B. is from the village of Compra, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 38 years old. Franklin is single. To make a living, Franklin owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Franklin has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Franklin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Franklin is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Franklin from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Paska

texts.en: Paska is currently in the business of selling sugar and salt. She is 21 years old and married to a driver with two children. One of the children goes to school. Paska borrowed a loan to stock more sugar and salt to sell. She hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 32 years old. He is married with four children between 2 and 17 years old. Theogene owns a business selling various products like beans, rice etc. This business is well organized. Theogene has been in this business for five years. He employs two persons to help him. The hours of his daily activities are from 8am until 4pm every day.

Theogene has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more products for his shop. This loan will help Theogene satisfy his customers. With the profit, Theogene will be reinvesting in his business and paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en: Myla is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a clothing sales business. Her husband Jamal, who is 35 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 3 and 6 years old. Myla joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Myla has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, to buy more clothes to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and for family needs. Myla is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To change a broken motorcycle and repair his old house

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old and is married. Joseph makes a living by selling a variety of goods such as sugar, rice, cooking oil and more. Joseph's business is open from 6am until 6pm every day and he has three years of experience.

Joseph has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase additional cooking and sugar to sell. With this loan, Joseph will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business and saving for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase additional oil sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: T. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. She is 35 years old and married to a tailor with eight children. All of her children go to school. T. borrowed a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Nalamae Ene

texts.en:
Nalamae Ene is 42 years old, married and the mother of five children. She has practised farming in Narok town for the last six years. She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of abode. This will be her second loan, which she is planning to spend on maize seed and also fertilizer. She hopes to use her profit to expand her farming activity by adding more acres of land.

Nalamae Ene hopes to grow her business, achieve better living, and educate her children. She is a thorough woman who is determined to achieve her objective if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy maize seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene, age 27, owns a small business where he sells various products such as beans, Irish potatoes, and charcoal. He has three years of experience in his business. The hours of his shop are from 9 a.m. until 4 p.m. every day. He and his wife have two small children, ages two and three.

Jean has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more new products to offer for sale. Increasing his products will allow him to more adequately cater to all the customers living near his business. In this way, Jean Damascene will be able to earn more profits and be better able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more new products to offer for sale

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson G. is from the village of Rang-Ayan, Mallig, Isabela. He is 56 years old. Wilson is single. To make a living, Wilson owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Wilson has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Wilson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Wilson is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Wilson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a mechanic for 18 years. He works on a freelance basis depending on customer's demands. He is a skilled mechanic, and he has a good number of clients asking for his high quality services. He helps his father with the household expenses. This will be his third Kiva loan. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase mechanical machinery which will help him make his work more professional. He has lots of plans in his mind and hopes to own a car repair shop in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase mechanical machinery

loans.name: Felicida

texts.en:
Felicidad P., age 60, is a widow and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She has three children. Despite the absence of her husband, she has been able to help sustain the needs of her family. She is engaged in the selling of dried fish. Through this business, she earns Php 5,000 a month.

Being a MIGS member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she has already accessed financial assistance. Now, she is applying for PHP 6,000 in order to buy additional dried fish for sale. She dreams of renovating the family house someday.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora, age 33, is a vendor of soft drinks. She and her husband, who is employed as a policeman, have five children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Flora has requested a loan in order to stock more soft drinks to offer for sale. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits she expects to be gained from this loan.

loans.use: to stock more soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S. sells fresh beef to her fellow villagers in order to earn a living. She and her husband, Keo Sokheang, age 31, who is an electrician at the local power station, have one child who attends the local school. San S. will be using her loan to buy a plot of farmland which is good for growing crops. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. In this way, this loan will provide her with a new asset that will benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Dominic Kingesi

texts.en: Dominic Kingesi N. is 23 years old. He is married with one child. Dominic is a farmer on his own piece of land. He has been farming for the last four years. Dominic learned about KADET from registered KADET groups. This will be his first loan to prepare land and buy farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve his living standard. Dominic's dream is to prosper in farming. He is a hardworking man who fights back to achieve.

loans.use: To prepare land and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice, age 40, sells maize grains to earn a living. She is a widow with four children, all of whom go to school. Joice is requesting this loan to stock more maize grains to offer for sale. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits she expects to be gained from this loan.

loans.use: to stock more maize grains to offer for sale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia, age 35, is engaged in the business of selling paste. She and her husband, who is employed as a driver, have five children, the two eldest of whom are enrolled in school. Lucia is requesting a loan in order to stock more paste to sell. She hopes that the extra profits expected from this loan will enable her to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more paste to offer for sale

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en: O. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. She is 32 years old and married to a policeman, with six children who all go to school. O. took out a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, age 32, earns his living as a motorbike taxi driver. He has been engaged in this business for five years and his business is well-organized. He gets up at 5 a.m. and works until 9 p.m. every day, transporting people to and from their workplaces. He and his wife have three children between the ages of three and seven years old. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan in the amount of 300,000 Rwf in order to buy essential materials for his motorbike. He will be repaying this loan over the course of eight months. His goal is to send all his siblings to school and to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy essential materials for his motorbike

loans.name: Goghi's Group

texts.en:
Goghi is only 38 years of age. She got divorced a few years ago and operates a jewelry making and selling business. After her divorce, she settled in her brother’s home and started her business because she didn’t want to become a burden on him. She is very skillful in her work and gets regular orders from different jewelers in the city. 

Goghi lives in Sahiwal which is famous for its cow species and agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her brother and his family. She has a five-year-old son who also lives with her and has not started his education yet. Besides her business, Goghi also takes care of household responsibilities and her son. 

Goghi has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her jewelry business. With the loan, she will buy materials such as beads, wires and glue for making jewelry in bulk quantity. This will help her offer more variety to her clients and make more profits. Goghi started her business 12 years ago and it is working very well for her. She won't leave this work and her marriage as well. She offers her jewelry at cheaper rates – that’s why she has a good number of clients. 

Goghi is hopeful that a loan investment will help her make larger profits and she will be able to start saving some money every month for her son’s education. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has responsibly made her payments and never gave any chance of complaints.

loans.use: To buy material for a jewelry making and selling business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, age 50, is a charcoal vendor. She and her husband, who is employed as a driver, have seven children, all of whom go to school. Alice is requesting a loan in order to to stock more charcoal to sell. With the extra prfits expected from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Mrs. Pilar M., age 67, is a widow living in Dulapo, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She has six children. After she learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she got interested and joined the co-op in October 2002.

She has started a business running a sari-sari (variety) store. She is applying for a PHP 14,900 loan in order to buy additional goods. It is entirely thanks to the co-operative financing her endeavors that she is able to implement this project. She hopes her business will be more profitable and that she will see all her children become successful someday.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Munkhbat

texts.en:
Munkhbat, age 40, lives with his family in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is a room clerk at a local hotel and both of his sons attend the public school. Munkhbat used to work as a retailer at an auto market called Da Khuree for several years. Since 2001, he has been running his own mechanic’s workshop in a garage. 

He started his business with a working capital of 500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks). His business has since expanded and now his working capital is 5,000,000 MNT. Besides repairing vehicles, he also buys used cars and renovates exteriors, repairs broken engines, and replaces spare parts. After such alterations, he sells the used cars at a higher price. Over the past few years, Munkhbat has managed to build a small new house in his own yard with the profits he has made through his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase and renovate used cars in order to sell them at higher prices. Munkhbat is working hard to support his children’s education, particularly as his oldest son is enrolling in university and Munkhbat needs to be able to afford the tuition expenses.

loans.use: to purchase and renovate used cars

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity, age 34, is a tomato vendor. She is a widow with nine children, all of whom go to school. Charity is requesting a loan in order to stock more tomatoes to sell. She hopes eventually to build a concrete house for the family with the extra profits she expects from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Kev

texts.en:
Kev A. is a widow and a homemaker with many household duties. She spends much of her time cooking meals and maintaining the property inside and around her house. She no longer has a life partner because her husband died of senility four years ago. She has five children, three of whom are married. 

She now lives with one of her married children who works as a sewing worker and whose husband is a Tuk Tuk (motor taxi driver). Her daughter and her son-in-law always share their earnings with Kev A. to use toward the family expenses. As his motorbike is getting old, it needs to be repaired very often. Kev A. wants to help her son-in-law to buy a new one, but she doesn’t have the money to do so. Therefore, Kev A. is requesting a loA. in order to purchase a new motorcycle for her son-in-law's business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for her son-in-law, who is a motor taxi driver whose current vehicle is inoperable

loans.name: Pierre Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 29 years old and is married with three children. He owns a small business which he sells different products such as books, pens and cosmetics. His business is well organized. He has three years of experience. Celestin's business is open from 6am until 9pm every day. 

Celestin has requested a second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more goods such as books, pens and cosmetics. With the profits, Celestin will buy a field and pay school fees for his three children.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like books, pens and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anarkul's Group

texts.en:
Anarkul S. is the treasurer of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the south of the Isykul region. She is 43 and married to a taxi driver. Together they have raised a daughter and a son. The daughter is married and the son studies at school. 

Two years ago, Anarkul rented a place and started to sell shoes. She opened a store and as a result, she improved the family’s living conditions. In the near future, she wants to purchase a car for her family, but still needs some additional funds.  For this purpose, Anarkul applied for this loan.

Where Did This Loan Come From? 

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her family

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежде Афониной 49 лет. Школу Надежда закончила на «отлично» и мечтала учиться дальше, но у ее матери не было возможности дать дочери высшее образование. Надежда окончила парикмахерские курсы и устроилась работать женским мастером, чтобы как то помочь матери поднимать младших сестру и брата. Через год она встретила своего будущего мужа и стала матерью двоих дочерей.  К сожалению, семейная жизнь не сложилась и после 5 лет брака, Надежда стала единственным кормильцем для своей семьи. Чтобы прокормить детей, она начала печь пирожки и развозить по поселку Кемин, раздавая по магазинам и павильонам, что позволило ей наработать постоянных клиентов своего товара. Также, Надежда продолжала свою практику в парикмахерском деле - в небольшой летней веранде она принимала соседей – делала стрижки и маникюр. Чуть больше года назад, возвращаясь после развозки выпечки,  Надежда нашла возле дома подброшенного новорожденного ребенка. Подумав, и посоветовавшись с дочерьми, они решили не отдавать малышку в приют, а удочерить. Теперь маленькая дочка Надежды дарит веру, радость и счастье своей семье.  
Также, в качестве дополнительного источника, с 1991 года, Надежда занимается содержанием и разведением поросят, в этом ей помогают старшие дочери. Надежда впервые обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум» и получила свой первый  кредит в размере 70, 000 сом (KGS) в сентябре 2009 года.  Полученные деньги помогли Надежде увеличить поголовье поросят и улучшить условия содержания. Свиноводство приносило  доход, но растущие потребности детей требовали расширения, как бизнеса, так и доходности. Так, Надежда решила обратиться за вторым кредитом, чтобы дополнительно увеличить свое хозяйство. Сейчас Надежда  планирует взять второй кредит в сумме 120, 000 сомов (KGS) на дополнительное расширение поголовья поросят. Надежда – целеустремленный и упорный человек и прилагает все усилия для того, чтобы поставить детей на ноги и дать им хорошее образование. 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.
texts.en:
Nadezhda A. is 49 years old. Nadezhda has finished school with high marks and dreamed of studying further, but her mother was unable give to her daughter a higher education. Nadezhda finished beauty school and found work with an established hairstylist.  She helped her mother raise her younger sister and brother.  A year later, she met her husband and became the mother of two daughters. Unfortunately, the marriage did not work out, and after five years, Nadezhda became the sole support for her family. To support her children, she started to bake pies and to distribute them in the village of Kemin, supplying them to shops and kiosks which has allowed her to create a loyal customer base.  Also, Nadezhda continued working as a beautician.   On her small verandah, she does hair and manicures for her neighbors.  A bit more than a year ago, while coming home from distributing pies, Nadezhda found an abandoned newborn baby near her house. After considering it and consulting her daughters, they decided not to give the baby to an orphanage, but instead to adopt her.  Now Nadezhda’s small daughter gives faith, pleasure and happiness to the entire family.

Additionally, since 1991 Nadezhda and her older daughters have raised pigs. In September 2009, Nadezhda applied for her first loan from Bai Tushum and received 70,000 KGS. The money helped Nadezhda increase her livestock and to maintain their living areas.  Keeping pigs has provided an income, but the growing requirements of the children mean she must expand the business and become more profitable. So Nadezhda has decided take out a second loan to expand her farm.  Nadezhda plans to take out the second loan for 120,000 KGS to buy more pigs.  Nadezhda is a goal-oriented, persistent person who is doing everything she can to get her children on their feet and give them a good education.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 33 years old and is married with three children who are between 3 and 8 years old. Francois makes a living by selling a variety of goods like rice, sugar, beans and body lotion, his business is well-organized. Francois has 10 years of experience, and Francois' business is open from 6am until 9pm every day. 

Francois has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a variety of goods to sell. With the profits, Francois hopes to continue to reinvest in his business and to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods like sugar, rice, beans and body lotion.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 46 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2004, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Lydia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is from Dipolog City. She is 60 years old, married and has 3 adult children. Lolita owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en: Virgie D. O. is from the village of New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old, married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a business making and selling specialty food products in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Virgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Virgie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from the village of Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 36 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates clothing business to local community members. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en: Mairamkul S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in Isykul region. She is 40 and married. Together with her husband, she is bringing up a son and two daughters. The son and the first daughter are at school and the second daughter is not yet in school as she is preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money, Mairamkul breeds cattle and she also cultivates agricultural products such as wheat and clover. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wants to finish their house construction. -====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie B. is from the village of Malibago, Oro. She is 43 years old, married, and has six school-aged children.

Lenie sells seafood products including fish and shrimp. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital.

Lenie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used purchase fresh fish and feed for her pigs. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur H. is 37 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 2 and 14 years old. He owns a small business selling different kinds of products such as eggs, water, juice and soap. This business is well organized. Viateur has three years experience and his store  is open from 5 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day. 

Viateur has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to increase his business by purchasing more goods to sell. Viateur will be able to satisfy his customers, which will help him to earn more profits and enable him to build his house and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: Dame  Akouélé  est mariée et a 5 enfants. Elle est âgée de 46 ans.  Elle exerce comme  activité  la vente de  produits d’alimentation  générale.  Elle  a commencé  en  1996 et  s’approvisionne au grand  marché de  Lomé.  Ensuite elle revend  les produits à son domicile à Avépozo à côté de la pharmacie.  Elle  demande  un crédit pour acheter  3 paniés de tomate, 2 paniés de piments, 2 cartons de tomate et 2  bidons d’huile.
texts.en: Akouélé is married and has five children. She is 46 years old. She has a business selling general food products. She began this business in 1996 and gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé. She then sells her products from her home next to the pharmacy in Avépozo. She is requesting a loan to buy three baskets of tomatoes, two baskets of peppers, two cartons of tomatoes and two containers of oil.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Naitiku Enole

texts.en:
Naitiku Enole K. is 28 years old, married and is the mother of four children. She has been farming her own piece of land for the past four years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan which she will use to buy maize seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity.

Naitiku's dream is to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. 

She is 39 years old, married to a teacher, with seven children, and all of them go to school. 

Rebecca borrowed a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to build a concrete house with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gad G. is 42 years old and is married with five children. He also takes care of two other children. 

For eight years, he has worked as a driver to transport people's goods to their places. He works from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day and he currently employs one person to help him.

Gad has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy new tires for his vehicle. He hopes to earn more profits. With these profits he expects to reinvest in his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S.  is 39 years old and  married to a businessman. They have five children, one of whom goes to school. 

Mary is in the business of selling fish. She borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to use her extra profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Ahoefa

texts.fr: Dame Ahoefa  a  4 enfants à charge  et est mariée.  Elle vend  les  céréales et produits d'alimentation  pour  améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Elle compte dans cette  activité  5 ans et achète les céréales et produits  au  grand marché de Lomé.    Elle revend  à son domicile à côté de l’école Agnassan. Elle est née à Aného et habite quartier  Benomé. Elle espère accroitre son commerce  et sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Ahoefa has four children in her care and is married. She sells cereals and food products in order to improve her children's living conditions. She has five years' experience in this business and buys cereals and food products at the large market in Lomé. She resells them from her home next to the Agnassan school. She was born in Aného and lives in the Benomé district. She is hoping to expand her business and is thus requesting a loan.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and food products

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 39 and is married with three children, who are aged two and 15. Odette’s husband is a state official, while Odette owns and operates a small business selling various styles of clothes from her home. Her business is well organised. She employs one person to help her and she has been running the business for three years, working from 8am until 5pm every day.
Odette has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing extra men's and women's clothes. This loan will allow her to attract more customers, which will help her earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 57-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He has worked in a poultry shop since 2007. In parallel, he has owned an apartment since 2009. He cooperates with his wife who works in a lingerie shop to maintain the family financial level at a good stage.  Recently, he got the idea of renting out the apartment so he can earn extra income. 

So today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on the apartment so it can be ready whenever a client shows up asking to rent it. In the future, he is hoping to buy more apartments and get into the residence dealer occupation.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on the apartment

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is currently in a business selling bread. She is 30 years old and married to a builder. All four of her children go to school. Julia seeks a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Lonkisa

texts.en:
Lonkisa O. K. is 36 years old. He is married with one child. For the past five years, Lonkisa has been farming in Narok town and earns a good income.
  
He learned about KADET LTD from the KADET staff. He is applying for his second loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the living standard of his family.

Lonkisa's dream is to thrive in farming. 
He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 42 years old and is married with seven children between five and 17 years old. Odette’s husband is a teacher. Odette owns a business selling various styles of clothes. Her business is well organised and she employs two people. Odette opens from 7am until 6pm every day and has been running the business for four years.

Odette has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business by purchasing various styles of clothes to attract more customers. The increased business will help her to earn more profits, which will allow her to buy a house.

loans.use: To purchase extra clothing to expand her business

loans.name: Nadupoi

texts.en:
Nadupoi E. N. is 50 years old. She is married and has seven children. She has been farming her own piece of land for the past ten years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff in her place of abode. This will be her second loan which she intends to use to buy wheat seed and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale and, also, to buy few cows for fattening.

She dreams of educating her children to a higher level of education. She is a thorough woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Umsunai's Group

texts.en:
Umsunai S. is the leader of this group. She is 52 and married to a builder. She has a son and two daughters. The son works in construction, the first daughter is married and the second daughter studies at university. 

Three years ago, with the initial investment of 30,000 KGS, Umsunai and her husband started to breed livestock. Reselling some livestock after fattening, they earn 7,000 KGS per month. 

With money received from the loan, Umsunai wants to purchase eight animals for breeding. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land to start building a house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys N. is 33 years old and single. 

Aloys runs a well-organized shop where he sells a variety of goods. Aloys has been in this business for six years. The hours of his business are from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day. He employees one person in his business.

Aloys needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Aloys will expand his product offerings and start selling food such as bananas, sugar, rice and so on. 

Aloys hopes to earn a lot of money and this will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and start saving for the future.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of goods to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and four school-aged children. He has owned a small grocery store since 2010. With his business income, he is able to satisfy the high expenses of the family in collaboration with his wife who works in a bakery. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory.  In the future, he expects that his business will continue to grow. It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. The strong network of community relationships are an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 39 years old and is married with three children between 1 and 5 years old. 

Fidele is widely known for his business of selling a variety of food. Fidele has been in this business for about 10 years and the hours of his business are from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Fidele has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business. With this loan, Fidele will start adding to his business the sale of foods such as rice, sugar, beans, wheat, cassava, etc. 

With the sale of these items, Fidele will expand his business and thus his profits will increase. With these profits, he will gradually keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: to stock a greater variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilize and maize seeds, and prepare land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase needed supplies in addition to buying extra agricultural tents.

loans.name: Bakhtiniso

texts.en:
Bakhtiniso F. owns a facility in the central city market selling fabrics for sewing national women dresses. She has been in this trade for 15 years. 

Her turnover capital has doubled since she started her small business. She is married with four children. She lives in Penjikent, Tajikistan. 

Bakhtiniso has a perfect credit history in IMON International. She has repaid all her loans without any delinquencies. Bakhtiniso believes a loan of 10,000 TJS will help her increase her working capital and profits. She wants to purchase more variety of fabrics and expand her marketing area. 

Bakhtiniso has become an entrepreneur through hard work and dedication and she believes this will help her succeed in the future. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of fabrics and expand her marketing area

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema U. is 30 years old and is married with two children who are 3 and 7 years old. 

Rehema lives by sewing different styles of clothes. This business is well organized and she employs two people to help her. This is her fifth successful year in this business. She operates her business from 5 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day. 

Rehema needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase four sewing machines and some clothing items. Thus, she will create another job for the people in her community. 

By expanding her business and adding more equipment and workers, Rehema hopes to earn more profits, and these profits will allow her to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase four sewing machines

loans.name: Kaleku

texts.en:
Kaleku O. N. is 46 years old. He is married and has six children. He has been working as a farmer for the past two years. 

He learnt about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan which he is planning to use to prepare his wheat farm. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and to educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and to buy a bigger piece of land. Kaleku is a punctilious man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his wheat farm

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George M. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  All of his children are currently in school.  George has a bar, which he has had for two years.         

To help expand his business, George has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more beer and soda for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, George hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, George hopes to finish all his rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase more beer and soda for resale.

loans.name: Abdunofe

texts.en:
J. Abdunofe, a 33-year-old married man who lives with his three children and wife, has owned a sheep-breeding business for the past three years. Because sheep-raising and selling is profitable, he has become a very successful businessman. Abdunofe, whose family members always help and support one another, works very hard and spends his weekend time with the sheep, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. He now wants to expand his business and buy more sheep and so is requesting a loan of $1500 USD. He thanks all lenders for their support.

And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase sheep in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with one parent and two siblings. She has been running a clothing store since 2006. She has a previous experience of 10 years in the same field. She always offers the clients new clothes collections. This has resulted in building an excellent business reputation and having a good number of loyal customers. Her business income is vital for her family; she is supportive to her sister.

 Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory. She’s certain that the loan will help her diversify her product selection. In the future, she is hoping to open a branch for her clothing store where she can also sell shoes, bags etc.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Mirzokarim

texts.en:
J. Mirzokarim operates a taxi service based in Penjikent, Tajikistan. He opened his taxi business three years ago. His business is the main source of income for his family of four, which includes his wife and three children. Hard-working, humble, and reliable, Mirzokarim’s dedication has helped him establish a high reputation among clients and co-workers. He works seven days a week and transports clients throughout the country. Currently, Mirzokarim is seeking a loan of $2000 USD to complete essential repairs on his taxi engine. This loan will help him to continue offering safe and reliable services to his clients.
