loans.use: to complete essential repairs on his taxi engine.

loans.name: Elizabeth Korondo

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been in the farming business for the past eight years. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of four children.

Elizabeth learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan which she is planning to use to buy fertilizer, seeds and chemicals. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to plough back into the farm.

Elizabeth's dream is to be a prominent wheat farmer and to improve her family's living standard. She is a conscientious woman who can achieve if she gets support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school. Grace has a business operating a milling machine, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more maize to process for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and sometime pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Grace hopes to open up another milling machine in Kumi town.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to process for resale.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is divorced with two children. She lives in Penjikent, Tajikistan and runs her small business selling fabrics for sewing national women's dresses. Farida is very disciplined and organized. She managed to start her business from scratch and has seen it grow and develop in the last 11 years. Farida is seeking a loan of 7500 Somoni to increase assorted merchandise for further retail sale in her kiosk. She is hoping to keep her venture running to secure stable income and meet all the needs of her family of three.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise for further retail sale.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom O. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Tom has a business selling second-hand clothes, which he has had for five years.         

To help expand his business, Tom has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more second-hand clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Tom hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Tom hopes to expand his business and also build more commercial houses.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
A. Jamshed is a married father of two children. He produces different fruits in his garden. To help meet the hard physical labor of his farming work, his elder son is working with him. Fruit growing is the main source of earning income to sustain this family. Jamshed is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. This loan will ensure the economic prosperity of this friendly family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and beauty products.

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en:
Mashhura M. is married and has 4 children. Together with her husband, she sells women's clothing in the central market. Mashhura has been in this business for 10 years. Mashhura's business is constantly growing. Two of the advantages she has in the competitive market are affordable prices and regular additions to her inventory. Her little vending kiosks are very popular in the marketplace where she works. Mashhura realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business, as loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and expand her business. She would like to make it easier for women to find comfortable and good quality clothing, which is why she is requesting a loan of 9,500 Somoni. One of Mashhura's further plans is to continue expanding her trade and eventually generate enough profit to finish remodeling her house and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter E. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Peter has a cosmetic shop, which he has had for four years.  He also has a second business selling shoes.  

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Peter hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Peter hopes to be able to educate his children up to university and also expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jalil

texts.en:
Jalil O. is 49 years old, married, and has four children. He sells dried fruits in the central local market. He has been in this business for 12 years. The dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan. They are served to guests and during family occasions such as wedding parties and birthday parties. Considering the constant demand for this type of goods, Jalil's business is quite successful and results in a stable income for his family. Jalil wants to increase the stock of his goods in order to be able to supply all the demands of his buyers. He is requesting a loan 6,000 Somoni, which he will use to  purchase dried fruits, such as raisins and apricots, and nuts, such as almonds and pistachios, with the purpose of increasing the range of goods he sells. Jalil has a positive credit history. He would like to thank all for support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits and nuts in order to increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N., aged 35 years, is married to Richard and they have three children: Fulla, Stephen and Thomas. They live in the Kingstone area. She hawks drinking chocolate and other drinks around Kingstone and its surroundings. She sells her products to different people in different places.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of Eastlands office. She has applied for her first loan of KES.12,000 to increase her stock of drinking chocolate for sale.

If the loan boosts her business, she plans to open a grocery shop. Alice describes herself as a focused lady.

loans.use: To increase her stock of drinking chocolate for sale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is currently in a business of selling alcohol, sugar, and fish. She is 45 years old, married to an engineer, with seven children.  Two of her children go to school. Lucia took out a loan to stock more alcohol, sugar, and fish to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol, sugar, and fish to sell

loans.name: Maliha

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 54 years old, married and has 2 children. She is an owner of a cowshed since 1970. She sells a wide variety of dairy products. She has a good reputation and she is well-known in her village.

She is requesting a $1500 loan to buy an ox. She is aiming to grow her dairy business bigger in the future and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy an ox.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat earns a living working as a taxi driver. Many weeks he works seven days in a row, always making himself available to drive. This not only makes him more efficient in his work, but it helps ensure a steady supply of customers. He typically makes between $15 and $10 per day. The more he is able to work the more money he can make. 

Shuhrat has requested a loan of 5000 Somoni so that he can have some welding work done on the engine of his car. Having a reliable vehicle is vitally important to Shuhrat’s business. We are happy for this opportunity to help him complete these repairs and continue to provide safe, dependable service to his customers. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to have some welding work done on the engine of his car.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice is currently in a business of selling beer, onions and tomatoes. She is 39 years old, married to a soldier, with four children and all of them go to school. Loice borrowed a loan to stock more beer, onions and tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beer, onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Luke’s Commercial Secondary School from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of SLL 7,600,000 in order to meet their various personal financial needs. Some of them will invest their loans in businesses, some will use theirs to pay school fees for their children; others will buy house building materials and some will buy pieces of furniture such as a bed or chairs. 

Mohamed V. is a teacher at the school and leader of this group. Mohamed was born in Kenema and is married, with children who are attending school. Mohamed is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for six years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees  and other school-related charges for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees  and other school-related charges

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. Over the years, he has proven to be a successful entrepreneur with his printing and photocopy shop with 23 years of experience in the same occupation. In parallel, he works with his sister in their own small grocery shop. He cooperates with his wife who works in a supermarket to earn a good income and be able to pay the heavy life expenses. 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase ink for his printing and photocopy machines. This will allow him to significantly increase his productivity and income by serving more customers. He is positive about his business prospects and plans to further expand his business. He is hoping to open a new branch of his shop in the coming year. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase ink for his printing and photocopy machines

loans.name: Alhassan's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SLMC Primary School in Kenema city. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones for each of the five members in the group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve on their standard of living. 

Thirty-five-year-old Alhassan F. is the leader of this group of teachers. Alhassan was born in a place call Taininahun, he is married to a trader and has 2 children who are in primary school. Alhassan is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 11 years now. Alhassan is going to use his share of this loan to buy house building materials – bags of cements, sand, iron corrugated zinc, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.  

School staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. 

But with the help of a loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy materials for the construction of a house

loans.name: Josephine Jerop

texts.en:
Josephine M., aged 38 years, is married to Simon who works at KPLC. They have four children. They live in Mbotela Nairobi. She sells secondhand clothes. Most of the time she walks around selling her clothes. She was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client.

She has been in this business for the past four years. She has applied for her third loan of KES.60,000 to add more stock like brassieres, panties and ladies' tops for sale.

If the loan boosts the business, she wishes to look for a store from which she can sell her items. Josephine’s hopes and dreams are to see her business grow. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock of items like underwear and women's tops

loans.name: Akwata Empola Women's Group-Kayunga

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, 39-year-old L. Juliet has been operating a tailoring business in Mazigo-Kayunga. It is a business the happily-married mother of 4 says she began with savings from her poultry business. Juliet says a close friend's advice was also paramount in her making that decision to get established. Day in, day out, this business generates her 35,000 UGX as profits. 

Juliet belongs to Akwata Empola Women's group-Kayunga and she says with this loan she is going to purchase more clothes-making textiles to make school uniforms to sell. By and large, she is anticipating better fortunes in the near future. She says she foresees this unfolding after she gets this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes-making textiles

loans.name: Roston's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you this group of borrowers from DEC Primary School Komende, in Kenema city, eastern Sierra Leone. Staff of this institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, for a loan of 3,200,000 SLL in order to improve on their standards of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house-building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children and so on. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible to deduct their repayment amount and pays SMT.  

This is the first loan that this institution has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Roston K. is the leader of this group. The 47-year-old Roston was born in a place call Kpuwabu, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 20 years now. Roston is married and has 7 children – 3 in primary school, 2 in secondary school and 2 are not of school age. Roston has requested for this loan in order to buy house-building materials – bags of cements and iron corrugated zincs for the construction of a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – bags of cements and iron corrugated zincs for the construction of a house for his family
